loans.name: Monica Sofia

texts.es: Mónica de 18 años de edad es una joven trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia. Ella se gana la vida en una empresa cercana, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder tener esta fuente de ingresos que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Mónica desea construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda para tener una mayor seguridad en la misma, ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un cerco de alambre que se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, tela metálica y grava para construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda y de esta manera contar con una mayor seguridad en la misma.
texts.en: Mónica, 18 years old, is a hard-working young woman who lives in her own house. She earns her living in a nearby business, for which she feels very happy to be able to have this source of income which allows her to sustain her household economy. Mónica wants to build a wall around her house to have more security in it, since currently she only has a wire fence which is deteriorated. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase cement, sand, brick, metal, metal mesh, and gravel to build a wall around her house and in this way have more security in it.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, metal, metal mesh, and gravel to construct a wall around her house.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 55-year-old married woman from Nagomari village. She lives with her husband, daughter and son-in-law. The family earns a living from agricultural activity. Specifically, they have 50 nut trees and a plot of agricultural land. However, the income is insignificant for four family members to cover even basic needs, and the family lives under poverty. 

To make her work more productive, Manana decided to start a trading business parallel to agricultural activity, and seek credit among local financial institutions. Her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Manana will purchase a stock of home products at wholesale prices and will sell them among her neighbors and villagers at increased prices. 

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase by 200%. Manana will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To start trading with home products to get another source of income

loans.name: La Restitution (1) Group

texts.en:
As the mother of five children, four of whom are currently in school, Nadège and her husband have their hands full. The two of them run a hardware shop together, selling everything from paint to tiles and spare parts. In order to help supplement the family’s income, Nadège opened her own used clothing stand last year in one of Brazzaville’s markets. Nadège was able to start this second business thanks to joining the community bank group La Restitution  (1) at HOPE Congo last year. Now Nadège would like to take out her second loan of 350,000 CFA in order to keep growing her business. 

Nadège helps lead a subgroup of eleven other micro-entrepreneurs who work and live in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. With this small loan, Nadège will be able to purchase more paint and spare parts for her hardware store in addition to several bundles of used clothing for her market stall. Having two businesses has allowed Nadège to dream of buying her own piece of land. She hopes to be able to save up enough money to one day build a home for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing for her market stall

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is a 59-year-old married woman from the small village of Kavtiskhevi. She lives with her husband, who is temporarily unemployed. Eter does her best for her family's welfare. She has a dairy farm and sells milk products at the local market. Eter always has high-quality products and has her own loyal customers.

In order to increase productivity and generate more income, Eter decided to buy another dairy cow and make more products, thus expanding her trading business.

Eter has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will greatly assist Eter, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Because of her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Eter will be able to sell additional products easily. She will be very thankful to the lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and expand her trading business

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su tía y sus 3 sobrinos desde hace 9 años. Él es un hombre trabajador y solidario que se gana la vida como albañil independiente desde hace mucho tiempo en proyectos de empresas cercanas a su comunidad y reparación que les realiza a sus vecinos. José desea encementar el piso de su vivienda ya que este actualmente es de tierra lo que le causa enfermedades respiratorias a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda sabiendo que no necesitará invertir en mano de obra porque el mismo realizará dicha mejora.
texts.en: José, 47 years old, has lived in his own house with his aunt and his 3 nephews for the past 9 years.  He is a hard-working and supportive man who has earned his living as an independent bricklayer for a long time in projects for businesses near his community and repairs that he does for his neighbors. José wants to cement the floor of his house since currently it is dirt, which causes respiratory illnesses for his family. For this, he asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of his house knowing that he won't need to invest in labor costs because he will do this improvement himself.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Jhojaira Del Carmen

texts.es: Jhojaira de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo desde hace varios años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, apoyada también por su compañero de vida que se desempeña como jornalero en una hacienda cercana. Jhojaira desea cambiar el techo de su humilde vivienda para evitar que la lluvia deteriore sus pertenencias por las filtraciones que tiene el techo, además desea encementar el piso de la misma y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jhojaira, 25 years old, has lived in her own house with her life partner and her child for some years. She is a hard-working woman who works in domestic service to bring daily sustenance to her home, supported by her life partner, who works as a day laborer in a nearby farm. Jhojaira wants to replace the roof on her humble house to prevent the rain from ruining her belongings with the leaks in the roof. In addition, she wants to cement the floor of the house and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and pins to replace the roof and cement the floor of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and pins to replace the roof and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Koulthoum

texts.en: Koulthoum is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman. In 2009, and after going through difficult obstacles, she decided to get involved in a professional career by cultivating and producing homemade food to improve their living conditions. And now, Koulthoum requires supplies such as containers and bottles to continue her production. To acquire those, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Koulthoum is confident that once she obtains the funds, she will be able to look forward to a much improved living situation for her and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as containers and bottles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Shg Group

texts.en:
Dali is 39 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is the group leader of the Jesus Shg, which consists of 10 members. 

Dali operates a food stall/restaurant selling breakfast and snacks. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to make food for sale. The main hardship that Dali faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Dali joined Peoples Forum to improve her business. With her business profit, Dali hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make breakfast & snack food to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Del Carmen

texts.es: Ingrid de 20 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de productos lácteos como: crema, requesón, queso duro blando, queso fresco, etc. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 1 año y 9 meses de edad en casa propia desde hace algunos años. Ingrid desea que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: queso, crema, requesón, quesillo, etc., y de esta manera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes para tener mejores ganancias para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ingrid, 20 years old, is an enterprising woman who earns her living making and selling dairy products such as cream, requesón, mild hard cheese, queso fresco, etc. She has lived with her life partner and her daughter, who is one year and nine months old, in their own home for some years. Ingrid wants her business to offer better earnings and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cheese, cream, crema, requesón, quesillo, etc., and in this way offer a greater quantity of products to her customers to have more earnings to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to invest in cheese, cream, requesón, quesillo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pipes, taps, elbow joints, and hire laborers to install a connection to water in her home

loans.name: Dayasagar Shg Group

texts.en:
The Self Help Group Dayasagar Shg is made up of 10 women who are responsible for their children who are under their care. They are originally from Koraput district, a place located in the western part of the Odisha state. They are characterized by being hard workers, responsible, and eager for personal growth. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, they were not able to go to school, and they needed to work at an early age to help with household expenses.

They are currently struggling day to day to bring better opportunities to their children. The Group President is Radha, and her occupation is the sale of grocery items and general household goods in a specific location in one of the markets nearby. Her business consists of selling goods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, wheat, cereals, soap, detergent, etc. She spends 12 hours a day in her business, offering her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to supply her business by adding different goods, so that in the not-so-distant future, she can obtain a better income. The group is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders bring to people of scarce resources in poor communities, to be able to have decent work.

loans.use: to purchase basic household goods, such as beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, and cosmetics

loans.name: Maa Gruhalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en: Maa Gruhalaxmi Self Help Group consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. One of them is Bhagabati, who was selected as the president of this group. The lady standing third from the right side in first row in the photo is Bhagabati. Bhagabati is 43 years old, divorced lady and staying with her three children. Two of her children are in school. She hopes to see them as successful persons in their lives. She has a few acres of land in her village and she is using her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her children are supporting her in this activity. She and her group have requested a loan of 150,000 INR. Her portion will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation such as vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su hogar apoyado en su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos actividad que realiza desde hace 17 años y que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Ella vive con sus 3 hijos dos varones de 17 y 9 años de edad y una niña de 13 años de edad. Ana sabe que en época navideña la venta de pollo tiene un incremento, por lo que desea invertir en su negocio para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor cantidad de productos y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda,  para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes en esta época navideña.
texts.en:
45-year old Ana is a hardworking woman who makes a great effort to support her family through her business raising and selling poultry, work she’s been doing for 17 years. She lives with her three children, two sons aged 17 and 9, and a daughter aged 13.

Ana knows that the Christmas season brings with it an increase in sales so she wishes to be able to fulfill her customers’ demands by offering them a larger number of chickens. She has therefore decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to buy chickens, specialized feed, and vitamins so she has more chickens to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: buy chickens, specialized feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Maa Barhmani Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
Tulabati is the featured borrower of Maa Barhmani Devi Shg. She is applying for a loan with the other group members from Kiva partner Peoples Forum because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Tulabati is a 33-year-old mother of two children who has worked for a year as a saleswoman in a cosmetic shop to cover her needs and expenses. She is a talented lady who has a good reputation, as she is known among her region for her proficiency in cosmetic sales. She is an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her own business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Peoples Forum to achieve her dream by opening her own cosmetics store. This loan is very important to Tulabati for it will help her make the first step toward a successful future.

With respect to the other group members, they are engaged in various works such as handicrafts, milk selling, etc. Tulabati is the third lady from the right hand side in the red sari.

loans.use: to open her own cosmetic store.

loans.name: Ronald Alexander

texts.es: Ronald de 38 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida y su hijo de 18 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 9 años. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como albañil independiente para poder sacar adelante a su familia dicho trabajo lo realiza desde hace 8 años. En la vivienda de Ronald el área del lavadero no cuanta con un techo que los proteja del sol y la lluvia cuando realizan los quehaceres del hogar, por lo que él ha decidido colocarle techo al mismo, pero además desea encementar el piso, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada,  clavos, cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y colocar techo al área del lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ronald, 38 years old, has lived at the side of his life partner and his 18-year-old child in his own house for the past 9 years. He is a hard-working man who works as an independent bricklayer to be able to get his family ahead. He has done this work for the past 8 years. In Ronald's house, the washing area doesn't have a roof to protect it from the sun and the rain when they do the household chores. For this, he has decided to build a roof for it, but in addition, he wants to cement the floor, and for this he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and build a roof in the washing area of his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and build a roof in the washing area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pliers, hammers, sledgehammers, shovels, buttons, fabric, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
Ruzigul is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in Pyanj district. Ruzigul is a seamstress. She has been engaged in sewing for five years. She learned this activity with help of her mother and elder sister. 

Ruzigul's sewing machine is old and she cannot work well. Her difficulty is lack of money. That’s why she applied for a loan to buy a new modern sewing machine. Ruzigul needs your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, bolts, and galvanized metal sheeting to finish building the roof of her house.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, who is a 54-year-old married woman, lives in the Samtredia district. Her husband works at the local railway and earns 400 GEL monthly, the only source of income for this couple. With her secondary school education, coupled with the high rate of unemployment, Tamar was unable to find a stable job. So she decided to start her own business and open a general store. The family owns a commercial space, where Tamar plans to start that activity.

Now, she needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to start trading. Tamar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a general store and generate her own income

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 23 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida comprando y vendiendo maíz, además vende prendas  de vestir desde hace 1 año, logrando obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Dora desea que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en prendas de vestir y maíz, ya que sabe que en época navideña la venta de ropa aumenta al igual que el maíz que es utilizado para preparar los deliciosos y siempre tradicionales tamales de gallina que se elaboran en estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old, and lives in her own home with her two children, who are 23 and 13. Dora is an industrious woman who earns a living by buying and selling corn. She started a second business a year ago when she began selling clothing, which provided additional income. 

Dora would like to boost her earnings, so she decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI so that she can purchase clothing and corn. She knows that clothing sales rise during the Christmas season. Demand for corn is also higher because people want to prepare chicken tamales that are a holiday tradition.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items and corn to sell.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 38 years old. She lives in the Samtredia district with her husband and two children. Her husband earns an income by selling fruits and vegetables, which is the only source of income for this 4-member family. This income is really insufficient for the family and they find it hard to tackle their financial difficulties.

Zhana has a great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan but her application was rejected several times for not having enough income or business experience. Her loan request was approved by the start up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses.

Zhana plans to purchase clothing stock and other accessories for babies and start selling locally. She will sell products from her house and will be able to generate her own income. The loan will greatly assist Zhana and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes in order to increase her family income and improve the living conditions of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pipes, faucets, elbows, and the necessary labor costs to make the connection for drinking water to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laying hens, chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en:
Sameena, age 30, is a married woman.  Her brother-in-law (also shown in the photo) is running a mobile phone accessories shop. He offers chargers, mobile phone batteries, hands-free and used mobile phones, etc. at good rates. He has good communication skills and enjoys a good client list. 

For the improvement of her brother-in-law's shop she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. It helped him purchase more accessories such as data cables, chargers, batteries, head phones, etc. to grow his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories such as data cables, chargers, batteries, head phones, etc. to grow sales and profits alongside.

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma es una mujer de 38 años de edad que se gana la vida con su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive con sus 2 hijas de 14 y 16 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 13 años. Norma desea tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela en esta época de navidad, ya que sabe que por las tradiciones son muy solicitados por sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para agrandar su producción al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en: Norma is a woman of 38 who earns a living with her business of raising and selling chickens, a business that she has had for 10 years and that has allowed her to raise her family. She has lived in her own house with her two daughters, ages 14 and 16, for 13 years. Norma wants to have a greater quantity of products to offer her customers in this Christmas season, since she knows that they are very much requested by her customers due to tradition. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins to increase her production as well as her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Jeremy engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He is a 30-year-old married man from Mcarthur, Leyte. He has a six-year-old son. Aside from fishing, he also does farming for supplemental income. Due to difficulty in financing his current source of income, he is in need of help.

 Jeremy has requested a loan to buy fishing net and a fishing boat. These are essentials in his day-to-day fishing activity. They will improve his on-going catch. In the long run, he will eventually recover, and start to handle  his finances.
 
 In the future, he would like to experience his family with a progressive life style by exerting more effort and he is determined to work hard to attain success.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a fishing boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 40-year-old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She has been engaged in poultry and hog-raising businesses for several years now. This is her source of income. 

Gina’s husband earns an additional income as a carpenter. Gina would like to take out a loan to buy more piglets and chickens to raise. This loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.   Gina’s future dreams include the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chickens to raise

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de frutas de temporada las cuales ella misma cultiva en su hogar desde hace 20 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad. María desea invertir en su negocio para comprar fruta y sembrar más árboles frutales y de esta manera cumplir con la demanda de productos con la que cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: árboles frutales y frutas para surtir más su negocio y ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria, who is 46 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living with her business of selling seasonal fruits that she herself has been raising at her home for 20 years. She lives in her own home along with her three children, ages 17, 10, and 8. Maria wants to invest in her business so that she can buy fruit and plant more fruit trees, and in this way meet the demand for products that she has. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in fruit trees and fruits to further stock her business and offer a greater quantity of products to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in fruit trees and fruits to stock her business.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo  junto a su esposo van sacando adelante a sus hijos. Lucia posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para la tienda como: azúcar, café, golosinas, arroz, detergente, aceite, frijoles, etc.
texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her children. She is a hard-working woman who through a lot of effort, alongside her husband, is helping her children to get ahead. 

Lucia has a store in which she has been selling basic necessities for a long time. With the desire to improve her sales and income, she has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a larger quantity of products for the store like: sugar, coffee, candy, rice, detergent, oil, beans, etc.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, candy, rice, detergent, oil, beans, etc. for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, vitamins, and concentrated feed

loans.name: Intore Group

texts.en:
Beata is 36 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 6 years; two of them go to school. The group is called INTORE which means “Selected People” in English. The members of the group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their businesses for a better future. 

Beata has a shop and has been in business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Ormoc, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or grocery store selling various goods to the people in her place. She has been  in this business for several years now.  

Helen is asking to take out a loan to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, and others. A loan will help her improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Helen has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, and others

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: José de 48 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a su familia apoyado en su negocio de compra y venta de pollo actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años y que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace 1 año al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos. José desea invertir en más pollos ya que sabe que en época navideña las ventas en su negocio son mejores por la gran demanda con la que cuentan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en pollos para vender en época navideña.
texts.en:
48-year old José is a hardworking man who makes a great effort to support his family through his business raising and selling poultry, work he’s been doing for 6 years. It enables him to maintain a stable income. He has lived in his own home for one year with his wife and two children.

José wishes to buy more chickens as he knows that the Christmas season brings with it an increase in sales. He has therefore decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to buy chickens so he has more to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: buy chickens to sell at Christmas

loans.name: Patience Lom Group

texts.en:
A loving and caring mother of four girls, Sarah Hatneilam is a very hardworking person. She sells vegetables daily starting from early morning until late in the evenings for sustenance. She works very hard to be self-reliant and her motive in life is being independent in financial matters as long as she is physically fit. Hatneilam, the profiled borrower, is the lady pictured with her hand raised. She lives with her daughters in Tuibuong village, which lies at the outskirts of a mini-town. Her daily activities include buying vegetables from suppliers and reselling them in the market at slightly higher rates. She draws her income from fractions of profit she makes by selling vegetables. The income is used to provide all the household expenses. 

Financial difficulty occurs at the time of school admission for her daughters at the beginning of new sessions. She desires to meet the educational expenses of the children by selling more varieties of vegetables, which is not possible without the help of an external source. With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of vegetables including cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, mustard leaves and others. She hopes to sell more items and earn more so that she can pay the school admission fees of the children, and buy new textbooks, uniforms and stationery items without delay. She is very happy with the lenders who rendered help in times of need. The remaining group members also send their gratitude to all the lenders. They are all very active in their business endeavors.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables like cabbage, beans, tomatoes, potatoes and mustard leaves to sell in the market place.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en: Jessa is a married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. She is also engaged in a hog-raising business. Jessa is asking for a loan to buy groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread, biscuits, and condiments, as well as piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Jessa dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread, biscuits, and condiments, as well as piglets to raise

loans.name: Mojash Shg Group

texts.en:
Mojash Self Help Group is a group consisting of 10 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Mrs. Rama who was selected as their president. 

Rama is a 30-year-old lady living with her child who is only four years old. The lady standing third from right in first row in the photo is Rama. Her husband passed away three years ago. She runs a grocery shop to give a good life to her son. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Marleni De La Cruz

texts.es: Marleni es una mujer de 34 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 18 años al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de pupusas, además vende fruta que cultiva en su hogar desde hace 10 años, por lo que obtiene mejores ingresos económicos. Marleni desea invertir en materia prima y utensilios para la elaboración de pupusas ya que cuenta con una excelente clientela a la que no logra dar abasto, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, repollo, maíz, harina de arroz, frijoles, volteador de pupusas, guacales, etc.
texts.en: Marleni is a woman of 34 who has lived for 18 years in her own house with her life companion and their 20-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living with her business of making and selling pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas, a typical Salvadoran dish]. In addition, for 10 years she has been selling fruit that she raises at her home, so that she can obtain better economic income. Marleni wants to invest in basic materials and utensils for making pupusas, since she has an excellent clientele that she can't keep up with. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in pork, cheese, cabbage, corn, rice flour, beans, a turner for pupusas, crates, etc.

loans.use: to invest in pork, cheese, cabbage, corn, rice flour, beans, a turner for pupusas, crates, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 46-year-old woman from the small village of Sachkhere district. She lives with her pensioner parents. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and produce cheese and sell it locally. The income is really insufficient for the family and they find it hard to tackle their financial difficulties. 

Irma has a great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan, but her application was rejected several times for not having enough income or business experience. Irma's loan request was approved by the start-up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, which gives people a chance to start or restart businesses. Irma plans to purchase clothing stock and resell it among her villagers and neighbors. The loan will greatly assist Irma and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and resell them

loans.name: Sofio

texts.en:
Sofio is a 37-year-old married woman from Kutaisi city. She has two children and generates income from her newly-opened general store. Sofio has her own customers among locals and passersby as well. To make her business more profitable, Sofio needs some investments to purchase additional and various kinds of stock of products and make more profit from it. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
With the start-up program, she will be able to have savings and provide a better future for her children. She awaits your support and kindness and will be very grateful for giving her a chance to continue her lovely business.

loans.use: To add products to her general store and expand the business

loans.name: Les Bonnes Volontes (2) Group

texts.en:
For the last six years, Fabrice has run his own restaurant in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, to support his family of three. In order to help grow his business, Fabrice joined HOPE Congo in 2014 and became a member of the community bank group Les Bonnes Volontes (2). Within Les Bonnes Volontes (2), Fabrice helps lead a subgroup of eight other micro-entrepreneurs and is currently on his fourth loan cycle. 

Through his previous loans, Fabrice was able to overcome the difficulty of having a stable supply of power to keep his meat and produce fresh, by purchasing a generator. Now Fabrice would like to take out a loan of 250,000 CFA to purchase additional chicken, fish, drinks and vegetables for his restaurant. In the future, Fabrice would like to be able to open a second and possibly third restaurant in Brazzaville. He dreams of being able to buy his family a piece of land on which they would build their own house. Fabrice hopes to one day bring in enough income to send his two children overseas to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, drinks and vegetables for his restaurant

loans.name: Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2004, 10 women from the small village of Koraput district stepped out, decided to build a secure future for their families and formed a group named Tarini Self Help Group. The members of Tarini Self Help Group are all women from the district of Koraput in Odisha, India. One of them is Damai, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand in the picture is Damai. 

Damai is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband is suffering from a serious disease. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her father, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took over the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, ladyfingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers as the vegetables she sells are fresh. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a larger scale. For this reason, she has requested a loan. She will use the loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase land, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a sewer system for her house.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 16 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida recorriendo las calles del municipio y el mercado municipal para ofrecer sus pescados y mariscos, los cuales vende desde hace 3 años para sostener a su familia. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y en época lluviosa sus pocas pertenencias se deterioran por el agua que se filtra en su vivienda, además desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda ya que son de adobe y el repello anterior a comenzado a deteriorarse, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria, who is 35 years old, has lived in her own house with her life companion and her 16-year-old son for 16 years. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living going through the streets of the town and the municipal market to offer her fish and shellfish, which she has been selling for 3 years in order to sustain her family. Maria wants to replace the roof of her home, since it is deteriorated and in the rainy season her few belongings deteriorate because of the water that leaks into her home. In addition, she wants to plaster the walls of her house, since they are of adobe and the last plastering has begun to deteriorate. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls and replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls and replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maa Barhmanidevi Shg Group

texts.en:
The Maa Barhmanidevi Self Help Group consists of 10 members from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Hilikina who works selling vegetables. Hilikina is currently facing lots of problem in terms of finances as her husband met with an accident some years ago and lost his vision and a hand. Through her job, she works to support her family and to improve her business. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo verduras de forma ambulante por los cantones cercanos a su domicilio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar. Marta desea construir un cuarto para la cocina de su vivienda ya que actualmente no cuenta con ello por lo que debe preparar sus alimentos al aire libre, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para la cocina y de esta manera tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Marta, 32, lives in her own house with her partner and two children, ages 12 and 4. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living selling vegetables on foot in the territories near her home. She sustains her household in this way.

Marta wants to build a room to be the kitchen of her home, since she currently does not have one and has to prepare her food outdoors. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a kitchen, and in this way, have an appropriate place to make her food.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a room for the kitchen

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is a 49-year-old, married woman with five children.  She is sitting with her brother in the picture.  She has been doing a business of cattle sales and purchases for many years.  She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000, which she used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Wandemi Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Archibald, 65 years old, married and blessed with five children. He is a dairy farmer and also practices poultry keeping and vegetable farming.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed for his cows. He believes the production will improve and thus there will be more supply of milk. This will improve his income; hence he will be in a better position to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

Archibald is happy for Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed that will improve milk productivity.

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, 10 women from a village in Koraput district in Odisha stepped out and formed a group having the name Maa Bhairabi Self Help Group. They help each other, share their problems and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. One of the women from this group is Jamuna. 

She is the leader of the group, and she has six goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes eight to nine months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then, she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way, she is earning to improve her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She and her group members have requested a loan of 150,000 INR for her group so that they can all earn more and improve their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase 10 more goats and their fodder and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, chickens, pigs, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Monicah, 56 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. Monicah is a dairy farmer. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management equipped her with skills in budgeting, record keeping and financial management. This has enabled her to run her dairy goat business more effectively.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more dairy goats in order to improve milk production, increase her income and be able to cater to her family's needs such as food and paying her children's school fees.

Monicah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats that will help improve milk production, thus providing more income to cater to family needs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, 62 year old, married and blessed with four children. He has a dairy, raises poultry and farms vegetables. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to benefit from its training in enterprise and financial management. This has improved his skills in business management.

Peter is taking out a 20,000 KES loan to buy certified seeds and quality animal feed to improve crop and animal production. Such improvements will lead to an increased income which will put him in a position to provide for the family’s needs with ease.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and quality animal feed to improve crop and animal production.

loans.name: La Restitution (2) Group

texts.en:
Simone is a member of the community bank group La Restitution (2), and helps lead a subgroup of eleven other micro entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For nearly sixteen years Simone has run her own grocery store from her home. In order to help grow her business, Simone joined La Restitution (2) last year. Now on her third loan cycle, Simone would like to take out a loan of 450,000 XAF. With this additional money, she can begin to buy items like vegetable oil, gasoline, rice and soap in bulk.

Simone and her family live in a more remote neighborhood of Brazzaville, and so Simone has a plan to become a wholesaler. This way she will be able to better serve her community's needs. In the future she hopes to grow her business to the point where she can sell exclusively in bulk rather than individual items. Simone not only takes care of her family of four children, but she also looks after her brother’s three children as well. In the future she hopes that they’ll be able to complete school and even be able to travel.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her grocery store

loans.name: Minto Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Joyce, a member of Minto Women Group. She is married and blessed with eight children.

She is a maize and bean farmer. Having undertaken the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise creation and management, Joyce decided to expand her farming business. To facilitate this expansion, she is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer. She believes this will enable her to increase her harvest thus generating more income. The anticipated increased income will assist in providing for the basic necessities for her family with ease.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer to help boost crop yield.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: María es una mujer luchadora de 60 años de edad que cada día sale a recorrer las calles de su cantón cargando sobre su cabeza una cesta de mimbre en la cual lleva la fruta que ofrece para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella vive con su hijo ya mayor de edad que le apoya con los gastos de su hogar, además vive con ellos su madre de 99 años de edad a la que apoya en su vejez. María desea invertir en más fruta para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, sobre todo porque desea ofrecer sus productos en los cantones cercanos para tener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en fruta para vender partida en los cantones cercanos.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and a fighter. Every day she goes out to walk the streets of her neighborhood, carrying a wicker basket on her head which contains the fruit that she sells in order to be able to support her household. 

She lives with her son who is an adult, and who supports her with the home expenses. Her 99-year-old mother also lives with them, and María supports her in her old age. 

María wants to invest in more fruit in order to offer a greater variety to her clients, especially because she hopes to offer her products in the neighboring territories so she can have a better income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in fruit that she can slice and sell in the neighboring territories.

loans.use: to invest in fruit that she can slice and sell

loans.name: La Famille En Christ Group

texts.en:
For the last fifteen years, Roselyne has run her own business selling newborn baby clothing in the markets of Brazzaville.  The mother of six children between the ages of twenty-three and two herself, Roselyne is well versed with the market for children’s clothing. With four children currently in school to help support, Roselyne has sought to grow her business in recent years. As such, Roselyne joined HOPE Congo and became a member of the community bank group LA FAMILLE EN CHRIST.  Roselyne helps lead a group of ten other micro entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of the Congo. 

Now on her seventh loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Roselyne would like to take out a loan of 400,000 CFA. With this money she will be able to purchase clothing and towels in bulk that she can then resell individually in the market. Drawing in clients with a clean, welcoming business, Roselyne always inquires after how her clients are doing. Little by little with the increase in her profits Roselyne has been able to build her home. She hopes to able to complete her home and open a second business selling drinks. Eventually she hopes to be able to travel to France or Benin to start a business in commerce. Roselyne also dreams of being able to send her children abroad to study and finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and towels in bulk to sell individually

loans.name: Mdidimua Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is in his late 40s, is married with five children and all of them are grown-up. He has been running a gengeduka (grocery stall) since 2012. He works from 6am to 9:30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Richard's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to start a duka business, increased on the genge and has paid all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of himself and his wife, loan dues and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his gengeduka stock. He dreams of starting a business of electronic money transfer.

Richard will share this loan with his loan group "Mdidimua" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his gengeduka stock.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
This is Annah, 55 years old and a single mother blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has a dairy, raises poultry and farms vegetables. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training has enabled her to improve her record keeping plus business and financial management skills.

Annah is taking out a 15,000 KES loan to buy chicken and dairy feed, which will help to improve egg and milk production respectively. She believes this will boost her income and put her in a position to provide for her family’s needs such as food and clothing.

Annah appreciates Kiva for its help and support and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken and dairy feed that will help improve on productivity.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Emily, married with eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She needs a loan to buy higher quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help her keep up with the demand for milk. She hopes this will increase her level of income so she will be in a position to continue supporting her family and improve their living conditions such as with better medical care and comfortable housing.

Emily is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy high quality fodder that will increase milk production and thus create more income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, fabric and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothing items, beauty products and personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick, wire, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a fence around her home.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 56, is married and the father of ten children. He is a small-scale vegetable and dairy farmer. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training by helping him realize his strength in business.

David is applying for a 15,000 KES loan to buy manure and certified seeds. This should improve his farmland’s yield, thus leading to a bountiful harvest. He believes that his profits will increase, and he will be able to provide a better education for his children as well as paying for the basic needs of his family.

David is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and certified seeds

loans.name: Banita Songa Mbele Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Julia, a member of Banita Songa Mbele Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. She is 68 years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Julia runs a grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits, a business she has been operating for the last four years. She appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on business recordkeeping, enterprise development, savings and financial management, as it has made her business thrive and be profitable. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell due to the increased demand from her customers. This will create an income increment and she will be in a position to cater to the family's basic needs with ease.

Julia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables for the grocery shop, thus satifying customers rising demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatos, corn, chicken, and spices.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Gladys, 57 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013. She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from HiH EA training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage her business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer that will increase her crop yield, hence more income. This will assist her to cater for the family's needs such as food, medical care and school fees for her children. 

Gladys is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will help improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Maendeleo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, a member of Maendeleo Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. She is 40 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013. 

Pauline does maize, beans and dairy farming. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and more profitably, unlike before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and animal feed. This will increase her farm production and meet the demand for cereals, thus providing an improved income. The anticipated income will assist her to support her children's education and meet the family's basic needs.
 
Pauline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as quality planting seeds, fertilizer and animal feed to help improve her yield.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca de 38 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 16 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una clientela que siempre busca sus productos, por su trato amable y sus precios accesibles y justos. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad a los que está logrando sacar adelante gracias a su negocio y el apoyo que le brinda su esposo. Blanca desea invertir en maíz, cal, y repuestos para el molino de nixtamal en el cual muele el maíz para preparar la masa que utiliza para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que tanto solicitan sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, cal y repuestos para el molino.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Blanca is an entrepreneurial woman that has made a living making and selling tortillas for 16 years. She already has a client base that always requests her products, based on her friendly demeanor and accessible, fair prices. 

She lives in her own home alongside her husband and two children, 17 and 16 years old, who are advancing in life thanks to her business and the support of her husband. 

Blanca wants to invest in corn, lime powder and spare parts for her corn mill, in which she grinds the corn to prepare the dough that she uses to make the delicious tortillas that her customers request so much. So, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, lime powder and spare parts for the mill.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime powder and spare parts for her mill.

loans.name: Marta Silvia

texts.es: Marta de 32 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 16 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo fruta partida como: papaya, melón, mango, sandia, etc., y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Marta desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que la madera y la lámina se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is 32 years old; she lives with her life companion and their three children of 14, 16 and 4 years of age. She is an enterprising woman who works selling cut fruit, such as papaya, cantaloupe, mango, watermelon and so on. Thanks to her work, she has been able to help her family get ahead. 

Marta wants to repair the roof of her house, since the timber and the metal roofing material have deteriorated.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized roofing, lumber and nails to be able to repair the roof of her house and in this way improve the quality of life of her family to some extent.

loans.use: to invest in galvinized roofing material, lumber and nails to replace the roof of her dwelling.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en: Veronica payed her first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to pay legal fees related to her house. She works in a candle factory were she is considered one of the more trustworthy employees.

loans.use: To pay for legal paperwork related to her house.

loans.name: Dulce Corazon De Maria Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a determined 52-year-old woman who is the eldest of a large family of fourteen siblings. Her life has been one of hard work but she always wanted to study and learn. She recently completed her primary school education with the goal of creating a new career. Rosalinda is married with five children, one of whom is adopted. She is providing the child with the opportunity to live and develop. This is a small example of what a wonderful person she is.   

Rosalinda is a very enterprising woman who has a business selling snacks and food at special events. She is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Dulce Corazon de Maria” (Mary’s Sweet Heart). With her loans, she has been able to establish and build her beauty salon. The new loan that she is requesting will be used to buy beauty products and furniture including special salon chairs, hair dye and other supplies. She has continued to meet the demands of her clients by being at the forefront of her business. This would not have been possible without the information and motivation provided by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer at the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank. Topics include accounting, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service and indebtedness. Other subjects discussed are hygiene, health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. The ladies gain knowledge as well as self-esteem and empower themselves. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is truly effective.

Rosalinda and the nine Trust Bank members are anxious to begin their new loan cycle in order to work toward achieving their goals and dreams. They are hopeful that KIVA investors will have enough confidence in them to offer the additional loan capital they need.  The  members of the “Dulce Corazon de Maria” Trust Bank are extremely grateful to the KIVA investors for their on-going support! We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the very near future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and furniture including special salon chairs, hair dye and other supplies.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.en:
Ubaldo is 61 years old and has worked in his car repair shop for more than 35 years. In the 1990s he bought a piece of land where his business has been located for the last 25 years. He works from Monday through Saturdays and provides service to many recurring clients. He started the business with his two brothers but now each of them has their own auto shop. 

His biggest accomplishments are growing his business and building his house. Ubaldo is asking for a loan to make some improvement and refurbishments to improve the image and get more clients.

loans.use: To refurbish his car repair shop.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.en: Alcides is a taxi driver he works from Monday to Saturday. He is single and lives with his brothers in La Paz city. Alcides needs another loan to fix his car. Alcides is still the only one at the family that earns money so he needs your help again. He appreciates your help.

loans.use: to fix his car

loans.name: Herberth Antonio

texts.es: Herberth es un hombre de 37 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años, la cual ha logrado adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como jornalero todos los días por la mañana en una finca cercana, pero además por las tardes cuida ganado bovino y ordeña obteniendo más ingresos económicos.  Herberth terminar de repellar su vivienda, y también encementar el piso de la misma que actualmente es de tierra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para terminar de repellar las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Herberth is a 37 year old man who for ten years has lived in his own home, thanks to his effort and tenacity. He is a hard-working man who works as a laborer every day in a nearby farm in the mornings, but in addition, in the afternoons, he takes care of some cows and milks them, earning more income. 

Herberth wants to finish plastering his house and to replace his earthen floor with cement. For these reasons he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand and gravel to finish the plastering of his walls and to put in a cement floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to be able to finish plastering the walls of his house and to put in a cement floor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish and expand fish farming

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro's cows produce around 200 liters of milk per day, which he sells to local distributors. He also cultivates corn on a field close to his house to produce his cows' forage. These two activities used to rely on expensive and unsustainable external inputs: chemical fertilizers, woodfuel and LP gas. In order to reduce his operating costs and to protect his environment, Isidro decided to invest in his own Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, which will allow him to use his cows' manure to produce biogas and organic fertilizer. With these two environmental-friendly resources, Isidro will be able to improve his farm's productivity and save money by displacing the external inputs. He is looking forward to contaminating less and to eliminate the toxic smoke that was filling his house when his wife cooked with woodfuel, also damaging her health. With the savings he makes, Isidro plans to buy more cows, continue to send his children to school and improve the infrastructure on his farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Tujikaze Arutani Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Helina, 41 years old and a member of Tujikaze Arutani Women Group. She is married and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2013. She received training on enterprise development and financial planning, which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise of maize and beans farming.

Helina is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer. She hopes this will boost her farming and thus increase her income. This will enable her to cater for family expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer that will boost her farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Penouel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Jaennette est une doyenne commerçante et membre d’une banque villageoise «Penouel», entrepreneuse, dynamique, âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est agent de gardiennage. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 100 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, accroitre son activité, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables
texts.en: Our client Jaennette is an experienced entrepreneur and a member of the Penouel banc villageouis. Resourceful and dynamic, she is 41 years of age, married and  the mother of seven children, all of whom are in school. Jaennette sells traditional "pagnes" fabric. She displays her merchandise at one of the market in her town. At some point she was able to obtain a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution. She has been in this business for seven years. Her husband is a security officer. This new loan will allow her to buy 100 sets of pagnes. She would like to buy a land plot, develop her business, and provide for her children's education and food. Finally, Jaennette sincerely thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking services  become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy 100 sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Maisha Bora Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Joyce, a member of Maisha Bora Self Help group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 33 years old, married and blessed with two children .She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) in January 2012. 

Joyce does vegetable farming of kale and spinach. She underwent Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which enabled her to acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase quality fertilizers and seeds. This will increase her produce and income, which she will use to educate her children, provide medical care and other family needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will help improve her crop yield and earn more income.

loans.name: Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Hezekiah, a member of Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group. He is 31 years old, married and a father of two children who attend school. He does maize and beans farming as his economic activity. He has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his business.
 
He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer. He hopes this will enable him to boost his farming and hence increase his income. He will, therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family, which includes quality education and modern housing.

Hezekiah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer that will help boost his crop yield.

loans.name: Ongemuiten Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Selina, a member of Ongemuiten Women Group. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. Selina does vegetable farming in her small family farm. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business well and profitably. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds, manure and pesticide to improve her vegetable yields. The anticipated income will assist her to cater to her basic family's needs and to pay school fees for her children.
 
Selina is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To purcahse hybrid seeds, manure and pesticide to improve her vegetable yields and hence her business income.

loans.name: Set- Kobor Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Darkilars, a member of Set-Kobor group in Nakuru, Kenya. He is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) in January 2013.

Darkilars operates a retail kiosk, selling household goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He underwent HIHEA training, which enabled him to acquire skills in enterprise and financial management. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand his business by adding more stock. This will attract more customers, hence more income, which he will use to educate his children and provide medical care and other family needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of household goods like flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Julius, 62 years old, married and a father of six. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013.

Julius runs a shop as his main business. With the training he got from HiH EA, he has been able to make his business more profitable. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more stock of items such as sugar, salt, cleaning detergents and other domestic stuffs for his shop. This will ensure he satisfies his customers' growing and rising demands. He hopes that his business will thrive and boost his income, thus enabling him to cater for his children's school fees as well as meeting other family needs. 

Julius is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy items such as salt, sugar, cleaning detergent and other domestic stuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a down payment on a car

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for additional stock of soft drinks and other products needed in her variety store business. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy several cases of soft drinks, which she sells at retail. She has to have more stock to meet the increasing demand for soft drinks in their area. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Ofelia dreams of putting up another store to serve the growing population in her province. She aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of soft drinks and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Tasty barbecue is Harry’s passion. He started his business, HarryDz, nearly eight years ago in Portland, Oregon with a hot dog cart. Later, he added pulled pork sandwiches to his menu, which were almost unknown to the area, and they were a huge hit! It was then that he developed a special sauce to make the pulled pork taste very unique, and his sauce also became a huge hit.
  
He and his wife moved to San Diego in 2013 to be closer to their newborn grandchild and started the business over again.  HarryDz has become very popular at the Imperial Beach Friday Markets, where he sells his sauce and sandwiches to local barbecue lovers. 

Harry is also a gospel rap singer and has a website (www.harrydzfood.com) where he shows his farmers market stall and a video interview, which have made him a celebrity in his community.  

Now, he would like to manufacture his barbecue sauce in larger quantities and needs capital to meet a minimum order.  He has decided to focus on the sales of his sauce since the sauce sells out every week. 

“People love my food and when they tell me ‘you did a good job,' it makes me feel very happy,” says Harry. “I love feeding people and seeing the smiles on their faces when they eat my barbecue.”

The loan with Kiva will allow him to manufacture a larger amount of sauce in a contract manufacturing facility, in order to meet the growing demand for his sauces.  

His dream would be for his sauce to be available to the whole country. Currently, he is selling online and at various local farmers markets in the area. 

“I am very lucky; I have two young brothers helping me,” states Harry. “They are learning a lot and they love to get to work with me.”
