loans.use: to manufacture a larger amount of sauce in a contract manufacturing facility in order to meet the growing demand.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus, 39 years old, is married with four children who are 11, 7, 5 and 3 years old. He comes from Rwakicunduro, Kyamurari, Bugongi Sheem District. This is his first loan with Ugafode. He trades in cattle, whereby he takes them to open-markets and sometimes his fellow traders come from different areas to buy cows from him. He works five days a week and six hours a day. He also puts much effort into farming, majoring in coffee, whereby he gets a lot of money seasonally.  He is borrowing UGX 1,500,000 to buy more cows for his business because he anticipates a lot of profit this season of school opening. He started this business after buying farmland where he keeps his cattle for some time while fattening them. He has a very responsible father who, though old, keeps guiding him and reminding him of his obligations. He started the business six years ago and since then he has never regretted it.  He hopes to be financially stable and educate all his children. He says that competition is very stiff out there.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a dairy farmer who faces important economic constraints, mostly due to the increasing prices of LP gas and the purchase of chemical fertilizers. By acquiring his biodigester, he will be able to displace these unsustainable and expensive inputs, as he will produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer. He will create a closed and natural cycle on his farm, transforming his cows' manure into renewable energy to cook and heat water in the house, while spreading the treated and nutrient-rich biofertilizer on his field, where he cultivates the forage to feed his cows. This will increase his farm's productivity in a natural way, while improving the cost-effectiveness of his activity. 

Juan Manuel will free himself from economic pressure, while turning his farm into a more comfortable and sustainable place to live: his cows' manure will not contaminate underground water sources anymore, nor attract flies and smell badly. Fossil fuels will be made irrelevant for his activity. With the savings he realizes, Juan Manuel first plans to repair the corral for his cows and his warehouse. Secondly, he wants to save until he can purchase an automatic milking machine.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ambileswar Shg Group

texts.en:
The responsible Ambileswar Self Help Group is made up of 10 members. The members of Ambileswar SHG are all women from the district of Bhadrak in Odisha, India. One of them is Jayanti, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised is Jayanti. Jayanti is a 55-year-old woman living with her husband and two children. She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes – mainly for serving food. She makes different types and sizes of plates depending upon the demand of her customers. 

She has requested a loan to purchase machinery so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like dry leaves, thread, glue and plastic and a machine for weaving leaf plates

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Floramie has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Floramie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Floramie would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Arjana

texts.en: Arjana has also started working along with her husband in a nearby restaurant; this has made it possible for them to earn some extra cash. Arjana has been photographed with Mariglen, her husband.

loans.use: to make some necessary sanitary additions to their family home.

loans.name: Baba Akhandalamani Shg Group

texts.en:
Basant is a 50-year-old widow living with her daughter, age 19, and son, age 16. Her son is studying and her daughter runs a small tailoring shop where she does repair work on the dresses of her customers. Basant owns and manages a variety store where she sells sarees (traditional Indian dress), bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, fashion accessories, etc. She has a plan to enhance her business by bringing in more stock of what she sells and adding some more products like wafers, nail colours, falls (used to attach to the bottom of sarees), shampoos, hair oil, etc. She says that doing so will improve her family’s economic condition. 

Basant, along with her group, has requested a loan of 180,000 Indian rupees (INR) and she will use her portion to purchase the above products. She has a dream of giving a good education to her son and saving some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, wafers, nail colours, shampoos, etc. for her variety store.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with one child whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 30 years old now.

Analyn has a peanut butter-making business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analyn has been in this business for two years. In the future Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 45 years old and one of her children is in school.

Elena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elena has been in this business for five years. In the future Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old and widowed with six children. With one child in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, beverages, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 38 years old and married with five children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Wilma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and married with seven children. With seven children in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Juliet has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Sonali is a 40-year-old woman living with her two children ages 16 and 13 years old. She lives in a village close to Bhadrak city in the Bhadrak district in Odisha. Sonali got married to a fisherman when she was 20 years old. Like other village folk, her husband was a fisherman who went to a nearby lake and river for fishing. Unfortunately, she lost her husband's mental and partly physical condition in 2009 in an accident when he went fishing. Since then, she has been working hard to support her children. She started the business of selling fresh fish and dried fish. 

Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated. Dried fish has a storage life of several years. Dried fish is used in different delicacies as fresh fish is and is very popular in the region. She buys fish directly from the local fishermen and sells some fresh and dries some to sell as dried fish. She purchases 10 to 12 kg of fresh fish and 18-20 kg of dried fish and sells it by roaming door to door in the nearby villages. She earns 4,000 INR per month. 

She, along with her group, has applied for a loan of 195,000 INR so that she can use her portion to purchase the fish in a bulk to make more dried fish and stock up during the monsoon season. There is a huge demand for dried fish during the monsoon season as not much stock is available in the market. So she can get a better price as well. This loan will help her to increase her working capital to run her business by increasing her revenues almost 50%, giving her 5,000 to 6,000 INR per month. She wants to save enough to give her children a good quality of life and send them to college.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk to make more dried fish and stock up during the monsoon season for her fish business.

loans.name: Maa Thanapati Shg Group

texts.en:
These 10 women from a small village in Bhadrak district in Odisha came together and formed Maa Thanapati SHG in 2013. Sabitri was selected as the leader of Maa Thanapati Shg. The lady who is standing with her raised hand in the photograph is Sabitri. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and her two sons. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her husband has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. What they earn is not sufficient to manage their family and that is why she is planning to expand her vegetable and paddy production. 

She, along with her group has requested this loan to invest in their respective activities. Sabitri will use it to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Shree Anukulachandra Shg Group

texts.en: In 2013, nine women came together and formed the Shree Anukulachandra Self Help Group to save money and help those who are facing problem in the group. Jayanti is the group member selected as the leader of the Group. The lady standing with her raised hand is Jayanti. Jayanti is married and has one son. She is 44 years old and stays with her son and her husband. Jayanti has applied for a loan for paddy cultivation. She is very talented and has been operating her business for the past six years. With the loan investment, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges that will allow her to do her work more efficiently. Her husband is also helping her in the paddy cultivation. Jayanti started her business six years ago because it is difficult for her husband to manage the household expenses in addition to paying for their son's education. Her son is enrolled in local schools and getting an education. She is confident that her son will be able to continue his education and become successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay labor charges.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coconut, groceries, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coconut, and groceries

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is 26 years old, with three children.

Kristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Kristina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Kristina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, and groceries

loans.name: Mirna Yesenia

texts.es: Mirna es una mujer de 22 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años en su vivienda. Mirna desea construir un corredor en su vivienda ya que en invierno el agua se filtra por la puerta y las ventanas deteriorando sus pertenecías, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, tubos, cemento y clavos para construir el corredor de su vivienda  lo antes posible y aprovechar la época seca para realizar la mejora.
texts.en:
Mirna is 22 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her partner and two-year-old son. Mirna is an enterprising woman who works hard every day to support her household with her business selling tortillas. Mirna has been doing this work for three years; she works from home. 

Mirna wants to build a corridor in her home as in the winter rain leaks in through the door and windows, damaging her possessions. Mirna is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood, pipes, cement and nails to build a hall in her house as soon as possible and to take advantage of the dry season to carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood, pipes, cement and nails to build a hall in her house.

loans.name: Meladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Meladis de 23 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 9 años, y es gracia a ello que logra sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie ya que desea que tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Meladis desea terminar de construir su vivienda la cual ha estado construyendo poco a poco, pero ya no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para terminar de construirla por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir su vivienda sabiendo que logrará cancelar las cuotas que el crédito implica apoyada en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Meladis is 23 years old and lives with her partner and eight-year-old son. She is a hard-working woman who has earned a living as a domestic servant for nine years. Thanks to this work she is able to move forward with her family and support her son in his education and give him a better quality of life.

Meladis wants to finish building her house, something that she has been gradually doing. She does not, however, have enough cash to finish it and so is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron. With this loan Meladis can finish building her home knowing that she will be able to pay off her debt with the money earned from her work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish building her home.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 15 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones, juguetes entre otros productos desde hace 15 años, dicha venta la realiza de forma ambulante por los cantones cercanos a su municipio. María desea reparar un cuarto de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar la mejora, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, polín y hierro para reparar un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and a single mother. She lives in a house that she owns with her two children, one girl (15 years old) and one boy (10). María is an enterprising woman who has been making a living selling clothes, lotions, toys and other products for 15 years. She makes her sales as a street vendor in the cantons near to her town. 

María wants to repair a room in her home as it is in bad condition. She does not, however, have the cash to carry out these repairs and so is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, purlins and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, purlins and iron to repair a room in her home.

loans.name: Erick Edgardo

texts.es: Erick de 33 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida con su pequeña venta de prendas de vestir el cual se encuentra ubicado en un pequeño local del mercado municipal, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este ingreso económico. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Erick desea invertir en su negocio ya que sabe que en época navideña las ventas de ropa son mayores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, faldas, camisas, camisetas, calcetines, etc. Y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is 33 years old and hard-working. He earns a living selling clothes at a well-located business in the municipal market. Erick is very happy to earn this income. Erick owns the home where he lives with his mother and nine-year-old son.

Erick wants to invest in his business as he knows that clothing sales are higher at Christmas. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, socks and more. With this loan, Erick can increase his income and offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, socks and more.

loans.name: Ingrid Margarita

texts.es: Ingrid de 23 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su pequeña tienda de productos básicos en la cual distribuye una gran variedad de productos tanto de consumo alimenticio como de cuidado personal. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 1 y 6 años de edad. Ingrid desea invertir en su negocio ya que en época navideña las ventas aumentan por lo que ella desea tener suficientes productos para cumplir con lo que demandan sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bebidas frías, pan, etc.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 23 years old and is a very hard-working woman who earns a living selling basic goods in her small shop. She offers a large variety of products, both foods and personal hygiene goods. Ingrid owns the house she lives in with her partner and two daughters, ages one and six years old. 

Ingrid wants to invest in her business as sales tend to increase at Christmas and she wants to have enough stock to cover demand. Ingrid is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, cold drinks, bread and more.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, cold drinks, bread and more.

loans.name: Carmen Lisseth

texts.es: Carmen de 30 años de edad es soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su padre y su madre desde hace varios años. Ella es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para sostener a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos básicos en su vivienda dicha venta la realiza desde hace 10 años. Carmen desea mejorar su negocio ya que en época de navidad las ventas son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas frías, azúcar, café, huevos, leche, frijoles, etc.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, single and has been living in a house that she owns with her parents for a number of years. Carmen is an admirable woman who works hard every day to support her family with her business selling basic goods. The shop is in Carmen's home; she has had it for ten years.

Carmen wants to improve her business as sales increase at Christmas. She is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cold drinks, sugar, coffee, eggs, milk, beans and more.

loans.use: to invest in cold drinks, sugar, coffee, eggs, milk, beans and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university fees and his graduation fees.

loans.name: Twende Mbele Group

texts.fr: Espe est commerçante, secretaire de la banque communautaire Twende Mbele, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 47 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché central de la ville depuis 16 ans. Elle va acheter 30 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Espe is a merchant, secretary of the banque communautaire Twende Mbele, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is a widow, 47 years old, and has six children who all go to school.

Espe has sold used shoes at the central town market for 16 years. She started this business with funds she received from her family. She is going to buy 30 pairs of shoes [with this loan]. 

Espe wishes to receive more credit, and to school and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: Lubira est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Wariti», client de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 56 ans, mère 7 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des poissions salés  au marché de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner 250 poissons salés. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lubira is a merchant, president of the Wariti loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is a widow, 56 years old, and has seven children who all go to school.

Lubira has sold salted fish at the town market for 14 years. She started this business from funds she received from her family. She is going to procure 250 salted fish [with this loan].

She wishes to increase her revenue, and to school and feed her children.

Finally, Lubira thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to procure 250 salted fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks and other necessary construction materials to build other rooms inside the house.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: Nteziarwemye est commerçante, membre  du groupe de crédits «Miujiza», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 29 ans, mère 6 enfants dont 3 étudient et 3 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de la tontine. Elle est vendeuse des matériels de couture à son domicile  sur une avenue de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 16 rouleaux de tissus d'habits. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté a la basse classe.
texts.en:
Nteziarwemye is a merchant, member of the Miujiza loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 29 years old, married to a driver, and has six children. Three of the children go to school, while the other three are too young to go to school.

Nteziarwemye has been selling sewing materials from her home which is on a town road for five years. She started this business with funds she received from the savings group. She is going to buy 16 rolls of clothing fabric [with her loan].

Nteziarwemye wishes to buy a piece of land, and to school and feed her children. 

She greatly thanks Hekima for their support of the lower class.

loans.use: to buy 16 rolls of clothing fabric

loans.name: Jamla Group

texts.en:
Hassan and Jamla are a stable couple living in peace and simplicity. You can find them as an example of people who are tireless and positive. Hassan is working as a farmer, but this is not enough with the financial crisis experienced by the people in the region. Jamla wanted to provide assistance to her husband so they decided together to start doing extra work breeding goats in addition to her husband`s work, so they can trade in milk and milk products. 

Because of their belief about teamwork and collaboration, which makes the work more successful and prosperous, they asked for a group loan to start their own business, so they will increase their proportion of income and live comfortably with their children.

loans.use: To pay to start their own business to increase their proportion of income and live comfortably with their children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To furnish the house.

loans.name: Tuungane A Group

texts.fr: Jeanne est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuungane A», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un Enseignant, âgée de 52 ans, mère 11 enfants dont 9 étudient et 2 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en légumes, épices et poissons salés. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a merchant, a member of the Tuungane A loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 52 years old, married to a teacher, and is the mother of 11 children, of whom 9 go to school and two are married. 

Jeanne has been selling basic food products from the town market for 30 years. She started this business from funds she received from her husband. She is going to procure vegetables, spices, and salted fish [with her loan].

Jeanne wishes to increase her revenue, and to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, and salted fish

loans.name: Tuungane B Group

texts.fr: Kavene est commerçante, membre  du groupe  de crédits «Tuungane B», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un hôtelier, âgée de 45 ans, mère 6 enfants dont 3 étudient et 3 n’étudient pas. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissions fumés  au marché de la ville depuis 19 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 180 poissons. Elle  souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kavene is a merchant, a member of the Tuungane B loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 45 years old, married to someone who works in a hotel, and is the mother of six children, of whom three go to school.

Kavene has been selling smoked fish from the town market for 19 years. She started this business with funds she received from her husband. She is going to procure 180 fish [with this loan].

Kavene wishes to increase her revenue, and to feed and school her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to procure 180 fish

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is studying at the university in her third year. She is a single lady.

She does not have a dream except to complete her advanced studies to enable her to work as a teacher in a university. This has been her ambition since childhood. Because of the financial problems faced by her family, she submitted a request for an education loan so that she can complete her study.

loans.use: To pay fees to be able to complete her studies.

loans.name: Jérusalem Group

texts.fr: Miderho est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Jérusalem», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent du service de gardiennage, âgée de 42 ans, mère 10 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché de la ville depuis 17 ans. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'un client porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Miderho is a merchant, a member of the Jérusalem banque villageois, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 42 years old, married to a groundskeeper, and is a mother of 10 children, who all go to school.

Miderho has been selling used shoes from the town market for 17 years. She started this business with funds she received from her husband. She is going to buy two bales of used shoes [with her loan]. 

Miderho wishes to increase her revenue, and to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

It should be said that one of the clients is holding their child [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy two bales of used shoes

loans.name: Bénédiction B Group

texts.fr: Bujuli est commerçante, membre du groupe  de crédits «Bénédiction B», client de l’IMF Hekima, célibataire, responsable âgée de 19 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son père. Elle est revendeuse des  cartes d’appel dans le centre ville depuis 1 an. Elle va acheter 50 cartes d'appel. Elle  souhaite devenir femme d’affaires et préparer mieux sa vie future. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en:
Bujuli is a merchant, a member of the Bénédiction B loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is a responsible 19 year old and is single.

Bujuli has been selling calling cards in the center of town for one year. She started this business with funds she received from her father. She is going to buy 50 calling cards [with her loan].

Bujuli wishes to become a businesswoman and to better prepare her future life. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 50 calling cards

loans.name: Bénédiction A Group

texts.fr: Maombi est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Bénédiction A», client de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 42 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est déjà marié. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu,  quand elle fut couturière. Elle est vendeuse de friperie au marché de la ville depuis 17 ans. Elle va acheter  2 ballons de friperie. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Maombi is a merchant, a member of the Bénédiction A loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is a widow, 42 years old, and a mother of four children, of whom three go to school and one is already married.

Maombi has been selling used clothing from the town market for 17 years. She started this business with funds she received when she was a seamstress. She is going to buy two bales of used clothing [with her loan].

Maombi wishes to buy a piece of land, and to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

It should be noted that one of the clients is holding her child [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase other goods such as ice cream ingredients to make ice cream to sell in the streets

loans.name: Genèse Group

texts.fr: Uwenge est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Genèse», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un pasteur, âgée de 54 ans, mère 10 enfants dont 7 étudient et 3 est déjà mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses amies. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché de la ville depuis 28 ans. Elle va acheter 5 ballons de friperies. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Uwenge is a merchant, a member of the Genèse loan group, and a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 54 years old, married to a pastor, and is the mother of 10 children, of whom seven go to school and three are already married.

Uwenge has been selling used clothing at the town market for 28 years. She started this business with funds she received from her friends. She is going to buy five bales of used clothing [with her loan].

Uwenge wishes to buy a piece of land, and to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy five bales of used clothing

loans.name: Kyon Sout Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyon Sout Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 17 village customers (6 Males, 11 Females). 

This loan will help some group members purchase young, and less costly, ducklings that are carefully raised for four months before starting to lay the eggs. Other group members will use the funds to buy high quality feed (costing $35 to feed 100 ducks for 5 days) . 

Kyon Sout Village has over 100 households and 500 villagers. In addition to ducks, villagers farm rice paddies, harvest seasonal fruits, raise livestock such as pigs and chickens, and a few open grocery stores out of their homes.

The above picture shows five CBO members from Kyon Sout Village Group, named, Daw Kyi, Daw Thein, Daw Win, Daw Phyu and U Win. In the center of the photo, Daw Kyi, is 44 years old and married with six children. Her husband farms on their two acre farm while she takes care of their 100 ducks. Of her six children, two of them who work in the city. This loan will enable her to buy high quality feeds that will increase the duck eggs as well as her income.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high quality feed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, responsable, optimista y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en las ferias de la comunidad de ‘Sacaba’, un lugar caracterizado por la abundancia de restaurantes de comida típica y por su clima semi-tropícal, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
Irene es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia, a medio construir de adobe y ladrillo, y cuenta con el servicio de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de papa de las variedades; Puyjuni Imilla, Aurora, Palta, Chola Puka Waycha, que son variedades comunes y de gran demanda por la población. Su comercio lo realiza de forma ambulante, ella se dirige a las ferias de las provincias del lugar; cargada de varios costales de diferentes variedades de papa, descarga los costales y retorna por la noche a su hogar. Este es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años de experiencia en el rubro. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa. Y desea realizar la compra de papa por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
Es por esos motivos que Irene solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de papa por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Irene, 32, is single and has an eight-year-old daughter.  She sells potatoes for a living.  She is a good, strong, hard-working, responsible, optimistic mother.  She works as a street vendor at the markets in the community of "Sacaba", a place known for its abundance of typical food restaurants and its semi-tropical climate which has a daily average of between 14-24 degrees Celsius.

Irene is short, has a dark complexion and wears her long black hair braided.  Her clothing is the traditional dress (hat, shawl and skirt) and her native tongue is Quechua although she speaks Spanish for general activities and her business.  She shares her life with her daughter who attends school, and they live in their own home, made of adobe and brick.  It has electricity and well water.

She sells a variety of potatoes: Puyjuni Imilla, Aurora, Palta and Chola Puka Waycha, which are common and in great demand among the local people.  She works as a street vendor at the markets in the province.  She carries several sacks of different potatoes to set up sales and returns home at night.  

This is her second loan in the three years she has been a member of the institution.  Her dream is to finish building her house.  She wants to buy potatoes wholesale to meet seasonal demand.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of wholesale potatoes to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: To buy a variety of potatoes to meet seasonal demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel for a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and metal sheeting to build a kitchen in his home.

loans.name: Amistosas De Rio Seco Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento Amistosas de Rio Seco está compuesta por once integrantes de las cuales son 9 mujeres y 2 varones se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.

La presidenta del banco es la señora Yudith es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida, Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad del Torno de la ciudad de Santa Cruz De clima cálido y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 20-35 grados centígrados.
Yudith es de tez morena, cabello negro habla español(sentada blusa rosada y cartera grande). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer y sus hijos; todos estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Su negocio Su negocio es la venta de comidas típicas del lugar, como; Locro de gallina (sopa; pollo dorado, arroz, papas picadas), Majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito y huevo), zonzos en pacumuto (yuca molida con queso a la parrilla), todo acompañado de refrescos tradicionales como; Chicha (preparada en base a maíz) y Somó(similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz). Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra ollas y utensilios para la elaboración de sus comidas y asi mejorar la atención a su clientela. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana “aprendí a cocinar desde muy niña porque le ayudaba a mi mamá…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante . 
Es por esos motivos que Yudith solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas y utensilios.
texts.en:
The Amistosas de Rio Seco communal bank is made up of eleven members, of which 9 are women and 2 are men. They work in various activities, such as vehicle upholstery, juice smoothies sales, cell phone cover sales, juice sales, perfume sales, soft drinks sales and clothing sales. They are applying for a loan to expand their businesses.

The president of the bank is Yudith, 43. She is married with three children, ages 3, 12 and 15. She has a business selling food. She is a good mother and a generous, understanding, responsible, hardworking woman. She runs her business at her sales location in the area of Torno in the city of Santa Cruz. It has a warm and humid climate, with a temperature which varies between 20 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Yudith has tan skin and black hair. She speaks Spanish. She is seated with a pink shirt and a large bag. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver, and her children, all of whom are studying in school. She lives in a rented house with running water, electricity, a sewage system and gas. She has a business selling typical food from the area, such as "locro de gallina" (a soup made with chicken, rice, and chopped potatoes), "majadito" (dehydrated meat, rice, fried plantains and eggs), "zonzos en pacumuto" (grilled ground yuca with cheese). All of the dishes are complemented with traditional drinks such as "chicha" (prepared with a corn base) and "somó" (similar to chicha, but it includes boiled corn).

This is her first loan with the institution during the ten year she has had this business. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She wishes to expand her business by buying pots and utensils to make her dishes. She will then improve her customer service. She works every day of the week. "I learned to cook at a very young age because I helped my mother," she says. Her dream is to have a restaurant. This is is her first loan with the institution in the ten years she has had this business. For these reasons, Yudith is applying for a loan to buy pots and utensils.

loans.use: to buy utensils and pots.

loans.name: Eduwin Ricardo

texts.es:
Eduwin es un hombre de 39 años. Casado, tiene dos hijas un varón de 14 años y una niña de 11 años, y su actividad es la cerrajería
Él es independiente, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘el Cosmos 79’ un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año. Eduwin es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su esposa que se dedica a confección de prendas de vestir, vive en una casa familiar, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería  donde se fabrican y arreglan cerraduras, llaves y otros objetos de metal., actividad que aprendió de su familia; él ejerce el oficio de cerrajero, Los materiales y herramientas que utiliza tiene que estarlas renovando constantemente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un arco de soldar  y herramientas debido a que es necesario esto para la realización de su trabajo ya que estas herramientas se encuentran en mal estado por el continuo uso. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eduwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de arco de soldar  y herramientas para renovar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduwin is a 39-year-old man. He is married and has two children, a 14-year-old son and an 11-year-old daughter. His work is locksmithing/metalworking. 

He is independent, enterprising, responsible and hard-working. He operates his business in the "El Cosmos 79" zone, an area characterized by informal trade in all fields, with hundreds of merchants set up side by side to offer clothing, food, meat, fruit, etc. The area has a cold, dry climate, with daytime temperatures varying between 5 and 15 degrees Celsius throughout the year. Eduwin has brown skin, short black hair, a short stature and dark eyes. His mother tongue is Aymará, and he speaks Spanish because of the trade he carries out. He shares his life with his wife, who works making clothing, and they live in a house owned by their family, built of brick and having water, electricity and sewer connections. 

His business is locksmithing/metalworking, and he makes and repairs locks, keys and other metal objects. He learned this profession from his family. He works covering household chairs with fabric, vinyl or leather. He comments that he constantly needs to renew the materials and tools he uses. His dream is to have a larger workshop in order to serve a larger number of customers. He would like to invest in his business through the purchase of an arc welding machine and other tools, since he needs these to carry out his work. The tools he has now are in poor condition due to continuous use. This is his first loan sequence with the institution during the 12 years he has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Eduwin is requesting a loan to buy an arc welding machine and other tools to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy an arc welding machine and other tools for his business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijos varón de 13 años, y su negocio es la confección de chamarras para damas.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, contante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘villa victoria’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son empinadas, la mayoría de los habitantes son ex mineros de diferentes centros que en la mayoría de los casos fueron relocalizados, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Norma es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de chamarras para dama, ella se encarga de comprar telas de todo tipo como; lisas. Impermeable, de colores enteros y otras con diseños para luego confecciónarlas como chaquetas en todo modelo y de toda talla. Labor que realiza en una habitación habilitada como taller en su domicilio, la venta la realiza su esposo de forma ambulante en diferentes mercados y zonas comerciales de la ciudad. “la ropa femenina es consumida constantemente con mayor frecuencia que la ropa masculina, es por esa razón que confecciono para dama…” comenta. Su sueño es realizar confecciones por mayor para empresas. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de material de confección como; telas, cierres, botones, hilos, etc., para contar con material constante de trabajo y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Norma solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de la época.
texts.en:
Norma is a 42-year-old woman. She is married with one 13 year-old son. Norma makes women's jackets. She is independent, enterprising, constant, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the Villa Victoria zone, an area located in the hillside of the city where the streets are steep. The majority of the residents are ex-miners from different areas who were relocated. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies during the day between 2 and 14 degrees celsius. 

Norma is dark-skinned and short, with long black hair pulled back. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. For business, she speaks Spanish. She dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and full skirt). She shares her life with her husband, who works in commerce, and her children, who study and work. They live in their own brick home which has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing. 

Her business is making jackets for women. She buys fabric of all kinds. The fabric is impermeable, and some is solid-coloured and others have designs. She sews the fabric into jackets of all styles and sizes. She does this work in a room of her home outfitted as a workshop. Her husband takes care of the sales, selling in various markets and commercial areas of the city.

"Women's clothing is constantly consumed more frequently than men's clothing. This is why I make women's clothing", she says. Her dream is to make clothing wholesale for companies.

Norma wants to purchase sewing material wholesale: fabric, clasps, buttons, threads, etc. This way, she will always have materials to work with and can take advantage of the season's festivities. This is her second loan with Emprender.

loans.use: to purchase material to cover seasonal demand.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 31 años, casado, tiene 1 hijo varon de 8 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de instrumentos de viento
Él es emprendedor, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en una zona alejada, no es comercial, tampoco ingresan las movilidades. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Daniel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (el primero de la izquierda). Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja como profesora de escuela y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y la menor en el jardín de niños. Sus deseos de superación lo hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, 
venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración de instrumentos de viento, como; zampoñas, quenas, tarkas, pinquillo y otros. Labor que realiza de manera independiente en su domicilio. “empecé hace 21 años con la ayuda de mi papá, es un negocio familiar que heredé de mi familia…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su taller propio, él desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo como madera y herramientas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Daniel solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la fabricación de instrumentos de viento
texts.en:
Daniel is a 31-year-old man, married, he has one sons ages 8 years old. He is in business making wind instruments. 

He is enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard working. He developed his business in a distant zone, it is not commercial, and vehicles don't get there either. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 1-12 degrees centigrade and where the solar rays hit the surface with a lot of force. 

Daniel has tanned skin, short black hair, is of medium height, his native language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work he does (he is the first on the left). He shares his life with his wife who works as a schoolteacher and with his children who go to school, and the younger one to kindergarten.  His desire to improve himself made him form a bank of people with commercial activities such as a transportation service, a video store, silverware sales, cellphone sales, chicken sales, flower sales, a tea service, and a tailoring shop, to ask for a loan and expand their businesses. His business is making wind instruments such as zampoñas [shepherd's pipes], quenas [indigenous flute], tarkas [indigenous flute], pinquillo [indigenous flute], and others. He does this work independently in his house. "I began 21 years ago with the help of my father. It is a family  business that I inherited from my family..." he says. 

His dream is to have his own shop, he wants to purchase the working material such as wood and tools. It is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 21 years that he has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Daniel asks for a loan to purchase working material to make wind instruments.

loans.use: to purchase working material to make wind instruments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 43 años de edad, viuda, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Ella es buena madre, contante, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Viruyo’ un área rural ubicado en cercanías del lago Titicaca y se encuentra a una altura promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar,   la región tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. La temperatura media anual en la región es de 8,8 ° Centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, los menores se encuentran a su cuidado. Toda la familia vive en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, ella realiza la cría y engorde de ganado a través del uso de la totora como pastoral y principal fuente de alimento, también alquila un campo dónde se ocupa del cuidado del pasto para alimento de su ganado, estos campos se secan en época de invierno y es cuando se utiliza la totora. Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días de la semana sin descanso. “esta temporada de verano es óptima para el engorde de ganado porque existen muchos pastizales…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su establo para criar mayor cantidad de ganado y desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno para su cría y engorde. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para la cría y engorde.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year old woman, widow, has three children ages 7, 4, and 2, and her business is the trading of beef cattle.  She is a good mother, constant, independent, responsible, and hard working.  She does her job in the "Viruyo" community in a rural area located near Lake Titicaca, and is located at an average altitude of 3900 meters (12,800 feet) above sea level.  The region has a pronounced diurnal climate where temperature variations during the day are more pronounced as the year progresses.  The median annual temperature of the region is 8.8° C (48 °F).    

Maria is of dark complexion, short, and has long black braided hair.  Her form of dressing is traditional (hat, shawl, and skirt).  Her mother language is Aymará which is spoken in the area; for trading in the city, she speaks Spanish.  She shares her life with her children.  The oldest goes to school, and the younger ones are in her care.  The whole family lives in a house made of adobe that has electricity and well water.  

Her business is the trading of beef cattle.  She does the raising and the fattening of the cattle through the use of the rush as a pasture and the main source of food.  She also rents a field where she takes care of the pasture for the cattle's food.  These fields dry up in the winter time, and this is when she uses the rush.  Her job is done every day of the week without rest.  "The summer is optimal for the cattle fattening because there are many pastures..." she says.

Her dream is to improve her barn in order to raise more cattle, and she wants to buy beef cattle to raise and fatten.  This is the first sequence of loans in the seven years that she has been doing this job.  It is for those reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to buy beef cattle to raise and fatten.

loans.use: To buy beef cattle to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Daniela Marcela

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de tres años y su negocio es la venta de libros y dvd educativos.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, buena madre, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un pequeño puesto de venta ubicado en la plaza que está situada en el centro de la ciudad, y es el centro del poder político de la República, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-13 grados centigrados.
Daniela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello largo negro, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realzia. Su negocio es la venta de libros y dvd educativos, su lucha diaria por competir en la venta del libros, es contante, anteriormente ya se ocupaba de esta actividad, actualmente se inclinó por las peliculas o dvd's educativos. "estamos en un momento económico donde algunos no ven el libro como un objeto de consumo de primera necesidad, el comercio de dvd's educativos esta entrando más fuerte..." comenta. Su sueños es tener una casa propia para habitarla con su mamá y su hijita. Ella desea realizar una inversión en la compra de películas dvd's educativos por mayor para aprovechar la temporada.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de películas dvd's educativos por mayor para aprovechar la temporada
texts.en:
Daniela is a woman of 28. She is single and has a daughter, age 3. Her business is selling books and educational DVDs.

She is entrepreneurial, patient, a good listener, supportive, a good mother, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in a little stand located on a plaza in the center of the city. The city is the center of political power of the republic, and it has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 3 and 13 degrees centigrade.

Daniela has a dark complexion, medium stature, and long, black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for the business that she does. Her business is selling books and educational DVDs. She strives daily to compete in the sale of books. She is persevering. She already had this business in the past. Now she is tending toward films or educational DVDs. "We are in an economic moment where some people don't see a book as a consumption item of basic need. The trade in educational DVDs is becoming stronger," she comments. Her dream is to have her own house to live in with her mother and her little daughter. 

She wants to make an investment in the purchase of films and educational DVDs wholesale in order to take advantage of the season. 

It is for these reasons that Daniela is applying for a loan for the purchase of films and educational DVDs wholesale to take advantage of the season.

loans.use: to buy films and educational DVDs wholesale to take advantage of the season

loans.name: Chaung Twin Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Chaung Twin Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region.  In this group, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee twenty-one village customers (seven men and fourteen women). This loan will help group members purchase ducks (costing $40 for 100 ducks), boosting villagers' income by producing more duck eggs. Some group members will use the funds to buy high quality feed (costing $36 for four days feed to 100 ducks). Chaung Twin Village has 164 households and 500 villagers. Most of the villagers are farmers and for additional income, they mainly focus on raising pigs, ducks and chickens as livestock.

The above photo shows five CBO members from Chaung Twin Village Group, named as, U Hla, U Aye, U Myint, Daw San and Daw Myint. Included in the picture, U Hla (First from Left) is fifty-two years old and married. He farms on his three acre farm and also raises pigs and chickens. His wife helps him looking after the livestock and the couple's two children, but not in that order. Like their fellow group members, Proximity's loan enables U Hla's family to purchase ducklings and high quality feed to increases income from eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Espectacion

texts.en: Espectacion is a sixty-year-old woman from the town of Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with six adult children. Her husband is a carpenter and barely earns enough for food. Espectacion helps her husband by selling pork barbecue, chicken barbecue and hot dogs. She also owns a Sari-sari (variety) store business. Her business has been thriving for three years.  She is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy hot dogs, chicken, cooking oil, catsup, canned goods and noodles. She hopes to be more sustainable and to save enough for the future without having to depend on her children.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, chicken, cooking oil, catsup, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Ta Man Gyi Village Group 3

texts.en:
This community is located in Ta Man Gyi Village of the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region in Myanmar. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 17 village customers (ten men and seven women). The loan will help group members to purchase high quality feed for ducks (costing $24 for five days feed for 100 ducks). Ta Man Gyi Village consists of over 360 households and 1,200 villagers. In addition to duck farming, several villagers also farm fish and raise pigs and chickens.

The above photo shows three CBO members and two village customers, named U Kyi, U Aung, U Zaw, Daw San and U Myint. Included in the picture, U Kyi (in the middle) is fifty-six years old and married with three children. Of the three children, one is a student and two are working. U Kyi farms on his 24 acres farm and takes care of livestock ducks and chickens. Like the other fellow members, Proximity's loan will enable him to purchase high quality feed for ducks.

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed for ducks.

loans.name: Fortaleza -25 Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento FORTALEZA -25 compuesta por Diez integrantes ocho son mujeres y dos varones,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; transportista, venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de refrescos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de ropa, por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
La presidenta del banco es la señora Lizbeth es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de variedad de productos según requiera su clientela.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Villa Fatima, sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y porque es una zona de gran tránsito que conecta a varias localidades de los Yungas.
Lizbeth es de tez morena, cabello largo color negro, estatura mediana(en la foto la señora que esta parada al fondo de chompa cafe con blanco) habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y viven en una casa que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y gas.El negocio es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, sus inicios fueron como vendedora de leche embolsada, actualmente es vendedora mayorista ya que entrega productos según a pedido como víveres, electrodomésticos, ropa en distintos mercados de la zona . Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa en seis años de experiencia en el negocio.  Su meta es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en líder en la venta y distribución de productos Es por esos motivos que Lizbeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda y necesita abastecerse así de esta manera  ampliar  su negocio y generar más recursos.
texts.en:
Fortaleza -25 Communal Bank is made up of ten members, eight women and two men who are requesting a loan to expand their businesses.  They work in various jobs, including juice shake sales, mobile phone sales, soft drink sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, and clothing sales.

The president of the bank is Lizbeth, 38.  She's single and has a 10-year-old son, and her business is selling a variety of products her customers need.  She's independent, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking.  She works in the Villa Fátima area, known for commerce in all areas because it's a busy area that connects various parts of the Yungas.

Lizbeth is dark and of medium build, and has long black hair (in the photo she's standing at the back, wearing a brown and white sweater).  She speaks Spanish.  She lives with her son, who attends school, in a house that has electricity, water, and gas services.

Her business is selling staple items.  She started as a vendor of milk in bags.  Currently she's a wholesale vendor because she delivers products on request in various markets in the area: provisions, electrical appliances, and clothing.

This is Lizbeth's first loan sequence with the institution in the six years she has had her business.  Her goal is to expand her business and become a leader in selling and distributing products.  That's why she's requesting a loan to buy merchandise, because at this end-of-the-year season she has a lot of demand and she needs to stock up.  That way she'll expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lidia Esperanza

texts.es: Lidia de 39 años de edad posee desde hace 4 años una librería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente los vecino, vende todos los días del año, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar más productos (cuadernos, bolígrafos,  papel de colores, papel bond, etc.) y una vitrina para  colocar los productos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos, para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is 39 years old. For the past four years, she has managed a bookstore in her home. Lidia has many customers, especially her neighbors. She sells every day of the year. With the income she earns from her sales, Lidia is able to pay for some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to my more products (notebooks, ballpoint pens, colored paper, bond paper, and other items) and a display case for storing her merchandise. As a result, Lidia will be able to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, ballpoint pens, colored paper, bond paper, and a display case.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for housing renovations.

loans.name: Ta Man Gyi Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Ta Man Gyi Village of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five female CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 23 village customers (7 Males, 16 Females). Ta Man Gyi Village consists of over 360 households and 1,200 villagers.

The loan will help the group members purchase high quality feed for ducks, costing $24 for five days feed for 100 ducks. In addition to duck raising, villagers also farm, fish, and raise pigs and chickens.

The above photo shows five CBO members: Daw Than, Daw War, Daw Soe, Daw Yee and Daw Mya. Daw Than, the first from the left, is 35 years old and married with three children. Daw Than's husband takes care of the family's ducks, pigs and chickens. She runs a small grocery store at the family's house. This loan will enable her to purchase high quality feed that will increase duck eggs and income.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed for ducks.

loans.name: Redab

texts.en:
Redab is a 42-year-old mother of three, living in Zarqa`a. Like all mothers, she wants to see her children become successful in the future. So, she is fighting all obstacles to pay for educational fees for her children.

She has a daughter named Shaymaa who is now studying at the university. She is in her third year majoring in goat breeding. Redab dreams of the day when her daughter will graduate. She requested an educational loan to help pay for Nadine's semester fees due to her inability to pay the fees.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Da None Chaung Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Da None Chaung Village of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Da None Chaung Village consists of over 500 villagers and, in addition to livestock, villagers farm, fish, and raise pigs and chickens. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 30 village customers (24 Males, 6 Females). This loan with help group members purchase ducks, which cost $40 for 100 ducks. This additional duck eggs will boost income. Some group members will use the funds to buy high quality feed, costing $22 for five days feed for 100 ducks.

The above photo shows five CBO members from Da None Chaung Village, named U San, U Pae, U Win, U Kyaw and U Aung. U San, first from the right, is 53 years old and married with two children. He farms on his four-acre farm and raises ducks, pigs and chickens. His wife is a tailor and both of his children are students. This loan enables U San to purchase 50 ducks and high quality feed.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Kha Yaing Baw Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Kha Yaing Baw Village of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Kha Yaing Baw Village has over 200 villagers and most men are farmers. Some villagers work as hired labor in other villages and are fisherman.

In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 20 village customers (10 Males, 10 Females). This loan will help some group members to buy high quality feed, costing $26 for 100 ducks for four days. Other group members will use the funds to purchase ducks, boosting their overall egg production and income.

The above photo shows four CBO members and a village customer. Their names are U Thet, U Tin, Daw Khin, Daw Tin M and Daw San. U Thet, irst from right, is 42 years old and married with five children. U Thet farms on his ten acre crop farm and raises ducks. The Proximity's loan will enable U Thet to purchase high quality feed and vitamins to increase duck egg production.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Kha Yaing Baw Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Kha Yaing Baw Village, of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Kha Yaing Baw Village has over 200 villagers who farm, fish, and raise various livestock such as pigs, ducks and chickens. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 20 village customers (13 males, 7 females).

This loan will help some group members buy high quality feed, costing $26 for four days feed for 100 ducks. Other group members will use the funds to purchase ducks to increase income from more duck eggs. The photo above shows four CBO members and a village customer, named U Kyaw, U Thine, U Kyaw K, Daw Ei and Daw Hnin.

U Kyaw (in the middle of the photo) is 45 years old and married with three children. He farms on his five-acre farm and looks after 150 ducks. His wife and two of his children help him on the farm. Like the other fellow members, the funds will enable U Kyaw to purchase high quality feed that will increase duck egg production, thus boosting income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Aka Ta Yar Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Aka Ta Yar Village, of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Aka Ta Yar Village has over 500 villagers and most of the men are farmers. In Aka Ta Yar, villagers also fish, plant seasonal fruits (coconuts, bananas and betel), and raise pigs and chickens. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 26 village customers (12 males, 14 females).

This loan will help some group members purchase young, less costly ducklings while providing funds until the ducks grow and lay eggs after 4 months. Other group members will use funds to buy high quality feed for ducklings ($70 per month for 100 ducklings).

Pictured above are 5 CBO members from Aka Ta Yar Village, named U Than, U Kan, U Aye, U Soe and Daw Inn. U Than, second from the right, is 40 years old and married. He farms on his ten acre crop farm. His wife plants seasonal foods and looks after the livestock. Proximity's loan will enable him to purchase ducklings and high quality feed that will increase duck egg income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate and expand her house.

loans.name: Hpa Yar Gyi Gone Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Hpa Yar Gyi Gone Village of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. Hpa Yar Gyi Gone Village has over 200 villagers and most of the men are farmers. Some villagers are also fishermen and raise other livestock such as pigs and chickens. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 25 village customers (15 males, 10 females). This loan will help some group members to purchase ducks, boosting income from more duck eggs. Other group members will use funds to buy high quality feed for ducks, costing $26 for four days feeds for 100 ducks.

Pictured above are five CBO members from Hpa Yar Gyi Gone Village Group, named U Kyi, U Aye, U Khin, U San and U Tin. U Kyi (middle of the picture) is 56 years old and married. He farms on his 6 acres and takes care of 200 ducks. He and his wife have a son, whose family lives with them and helps U Kyi on the farm. Like his fellow villagers, Proximity's loan will enable U Kyi to purchase high quality feed that will increase duck egg production and boost income.

loans.use: to purchase duck and high quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Hpa Yar Gyi Gone Village Group

loans.name: Ma Yae Pyar Mout Village Group

texts.en:
The Ma Yae Pyar Mout Village is located in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, four CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 30 village customers (14 males, 16 female). This loan will help the group members purchase ducklings and high quality feed for ducks (costing $27, five days feed for 100 ducks).

Ma Yae Pyar Mout Village has 176 households and over 900 villagers. Most of the men in the village are farmers and some work as day laborers in town or other villages. Many households plant different kinds of flowers and seasonal foods. For additional income, some have additional livestock such as pigs and chickens.

Pictured above are four CBO members from Ma Yae Pyar Mout, named U Than, U San, , U Kan and Daw Yin. U Aye, a community leader, is not taking a loan but helping with coordination. U Than (first from the left) is 54 years old and married. He is a farmer and has seven acres of land. U Than takes care of his livestock, while his wife sells his farm's flowers. The couple has eight children, five daughters and three sons. Like his fellow villagers, U Than will purchase ducklings and high quality feed with Proximity's loan.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yae Pyar Mout Village Group

loans.name: Tha Lake Kyaung Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Tha Lake Kyaung Village, of the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 22 village customers (11 males, 11 females). This loan will help group members to purchase young, less costly ducklings while providing liquidity until the ducks begin laying eggs after 5 months. This liquidity will go into buying high quality duck feed ($70 per month for 100 ducklings).

Tha Lake Kyaung Village has over 160 households and over 700 villagers. Most residents are farmers. For additional income, they plant seasonal fruits (lemons, coconuts and bananas) and also raise pigs and chickens.

Pictured above are four CBO members and a village customer from this community, named U Kyaw, U Myint, U Win, U Htan and Daw Mar. CBO member U Kyaw, second from right, is 29 years old and married with two children. He farms his four acres and also looks after his ducks and chickens. Like his fellow villagers, Proximity's loan will enable U Kyaw to purchase 200 ducklings (costing $140) and high quality feed.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high quality feed.

loans.name: Flor De Kantuta Ii Group

texts.es:
