El banco de emprendimiento FLOR DE KANTUTA II compuesta por ocho integrantes todas son mujeres,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
La presidenta del banco es la señora Lysbeth es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos un varón de 8 años y dos mujeres de 6 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de variedad de dulces, galletas, refrescos, etc.
Ella es buena persona, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Salvador, sitio caracterizado por el comercio ella vende sus productos cerca de un establecimiento educativo, pronto empezara las clases y así que aprovecha esta oportunidad para abastecerse de mercadería razón por la cual solicita el prestamos es para la compra de mercadería surtida.
Lysbeth es de tez morena, cabello negro, estatura mediana (en la foto es la que está cerca a la ventana con chompa morada polera celeste y buzo azul) habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijos que estudian en la escuela donde ella trabaja así les puede ver a diario a sus pequeños en época de clases escolares y viven en una casa que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y gas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa en seis años de experiencia en el negocio.  Su meta es ampliar su negocio Es por esos motivos que Lysbeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que esta época de inicio de año por reinicio de labores escolares  tiene mucha demanda y necesita abastecerse de productos,  así de esta manera  ampliar  su negocio y generar más recursos.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank Flor De Kantuta II is comprised of 8 members who are all women. They work in various roles such as: selling fruits, selling smoothies, selling cell phones, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling food, and selling vegetables. For this reason, they are requesting a loan to grow their businesses.
The president of the bank is Lysbeth, a 24 year old woman who is married and has 3 children, an 8 year old son and two girls who are 6 and 3. Her business is selling confectionary, cookies, sodas, etc.
She is a good person, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the Salvador area, a place known for business. She sells her products close  to an education institute. Classes start soon and she is taking advantage of this opportunity to stock-up - she is requesting a loan to buy stock.
Lysbeth has a dark complexion, black hair, and is of medium height (in the photo, she is the one close to the window in the purple sweater, light blue t-shirt, and blue sweat pants). She speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children, who study in the school where she works so she can see her little ones every day during the school year. They live in a house that has electricity, water, and gas supply. This is her first loan with this organization in her 6 years of experience running the business. Her goal is to grow her business. This is why Lysbeth is requesting a loan to buy supplies at the start of the year when the school starts again and she has a lot of demand and needs to stock-up on products. In this way, she can grow her business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business selling snacks.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento VICUÑITAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI compuesta por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, transporte, mecánica,  venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Luisa es una mujer de 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijas de 18, 16 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida, ella vende Ají de fideo
Luisa es buena madre, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto que se caracteriza por encontrarse  a 3.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Luisa es de tez morena, cabello negro, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro chompa ploma pantalón plomo  y chaleco azul). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y una en la universidad, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la hicieron formar una banca de personas. Su negocio es la venta de comida ella realiza el conocido ají de fideo (carne de res, habas verdes, chuño,fideo y mucho aji picante),. Oficio que aprendí desde muy niña ayudando a su mama quien también vendía este plato…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda vender comida con comodidad. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carnes, fideos, arroz, papa, chuño y otros, para cocinar durante las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estar abastecida durante las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank Vicuñitas de Huayna Potosi is comprised of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men. They work in various roles including: selling fruit, selling juices, transport, mechanic, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling food, and selling vegetables. They are requesting a loan to grow their businesses. 
Luisa is 46 year old woman who has 3 daughters who are 18, 16, and 13 years old and her business is selling food. She sells ají de fideo (a local pasta dish). 
Luisa is a good mother, committed to her work, and responsible. She runs her business in the Ceja area of the city of El Alto, which is 3,800 meters above sea level.
Luisa has a dark complexion, black hair, and is short. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish in general and for her business. (She is seated in the center in the grey sweater, grey pants, and blue vest). She shares her life with her children who are in school and in the university. They live in a rented house which has drinking water, electricity, and city sewers. Her desire to grow her business made her form a bank group. Her business is selling food that she makes, particularly the locally well know ají de fideo (beef, green beans, local dried potatoes, pasta, and a lot of hot chili). She learned to do this when she was very small helping her mother who also sold this dish, she tells us. Her dream is to have a restaurant where she can sell her food in comfort. She wants to make an investment in her business by buying supplies in bulk such as: meats, pasta, rice, potatoes, dried potatoes, and other items, so she can cook during the year end festivals. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in 6 years during which she has been developing this business. 
This is why Luisa is requesting this loan to buy cooking supplies so she is stocked-up for the end of the year festivals.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza City. His father works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. Rami is a student specializing in journalism at a local college. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to help his family and improve their living conditions.

Rami took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him to buy an electronic tablet for his studies. This loan will enable Rami to read more articles and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy an electronic tablet for his studies

loans.name: Yay Kyaw Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Yay Kyaw Village, in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region of Myanmar. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 16 village customers (eight men and eight women). This loan will help some group members buy high quality feed (costing $25 for four days feeds for 100 ducks) as well as vitamins that will increase egg production. 

Yay Kyaw Village has over 70 households and 400 villagers. Most of the villagers are farmers and a few are fishermen. For additional income, some households also have small grocery stores at their homes and raise pigs and chickens. 

Pictured above are four CBO members and a village customer, named Daw Hte, U Maung, U Kyaw, U Sa and U Myint. Daw Hte, included in the picture (in the middle), is forty-eight years old and married. She and her husband farm their five acre crop farm, and have ducks and seven pigs as livestock. Daw Hte has four children, one of whom works in Yangon. Like her fellow villagers, Proximity's loan will enable Daw Hte to purchase ducklings and high quality feed that will increase duck egg production, which will then boost income.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed and vitamins for ducks.

loans.name: Min Hla Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Min Hla Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 30 village customers (fourteen men and sixteen women). This loan will help some group members purchase high quality duck feed (costing $30 of 6 days feed for 100 ducks) and other members to rebuild their duck farms (costing $40 for a hundred duck farm). 

Min Hla Village has over 600 villagers and most are farmers.  For additional income, some households also plant seasonal food and raise pigs and chickens. Some of the younger villagers work across the village as hired laborers. 

The above photo includes four CBO members and a village customer from Min Hla Group 2 Village, named U Tin, U Win, U Than, U Win T and U Khin. U Tin (first on the left) is fifty-three years old and married with one son, who is a seaman currently on a six month assignment. U Tin raises ducks and pigs.  Like his fellow villagers, U Tin will use Proximity's loan to repair his destroyed duck farm and purchase high quality feed that will enable him to increase duck egg production to boost his income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and rebuild a duck farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood and other supplies for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.en:
Abdel Kader is an 18-year-old single man from Jenin, where he lives with his family in a very simple house. One year ago, Abdel opened a store to sell cosmetic products and gifts in the city. It is a very good business and the demand is high. Abdel loves his job and would like to improve it and open a bigger store in the future.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy more cosmetic products to resell at his store. This loan will enable Abdel to increase his sales and his income. Abdel appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to resell at his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of wedding dresses for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement, sand and gravel to renovate the house.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Mary Jane resides in Estancia, Iloilo in the Philippines.  She is married with three children aged four, eight and twelve. Her husband is a carpenter and also a farmer. Mary Jane on the other hand helps to cover family expenses by selling gasoline on a per liter basis using empty Coca Cola bottles. She also operates a Sari-sari (variety) store and a tricycle business to transport passengers. 

Mary Jane is asking a loan to buy chips, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, noodles, an electronic load wallet and gasoline. The loan will allow her to replenish her stocks and offer her customers a better service, as she will have more merchandise available.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so she can contribute to her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy chips, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, noodles, an electronic load wallet and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate the house

loans.name: Ta Man Gyi Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 18 village customers (twelve men and six women). The loan will help group members to purchase high quality feed for ducks (costing $24 for five days feed for 100 ducks). Ta Man Gyi Village consists of over 360 households and 1,200 villagers. In addition to livestock, the villagers farm fish, and raise pigs and chickens.

The above photo shows four CBO members, named U Than, U Hla, U Aung and Daw Tin. U Than (First from right) is forty-four years old and married with eight children. His family farms on his 10 acres and raises ducks, pigs and chickens. Proximity's loan will enable U Than to buy high quality feed that will increase his duck egg production, boosting income.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed for ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to take driving lessons on a truck and pay the fees for a license.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, 23 years old, is from Ajloun and she has three brothers. Balqees is an honest, hardworking, ambitious and responsible person who is very dedicated to her studies. She wishes to be successful with her efforts to meet her goals: to have a degree in computer science in order to be able to work independently. She also dreams of having her own business. Balqees seeks this loan to be able to pay her university bills so she will be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university bills so she will be able to continue with her studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Beddya, a village near Nablus. Three years ago, he opened his own workshop for home electrical repair. It is a very good business and provides a good income. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy repair parts and new tools for his electrical workshop. This loan will enable Mohammad to increase his productivity and his income. Mohammad appears in the photo while working.

loans.use: to buy repair parts and new tools for his electrical workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new barbecue machine for his food stall.

loans.name: Hana'a

texts.en:
Hana`a has a small project which is a school supplies shop. She is asking for a loan to improve her project and to be able to buy new tools to sell
.
Hanaa lives with her family and is forty-six years old. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular ones. She is managing her business and working hard to help her family cover household expenses. This loan will help her to achieve her dreams. Hanaa is waiting for your support.

loans.use: buy new tools to sell

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Mayer es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 9, 6 Y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de embutidos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’; lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento de su población realizada inmigrantes lugareños y del occidente del país, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura ambiente de 30 grados centígrados.
Mayer es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro, usa suéter gris y cartera negra). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte y sus tres hijos mayores estudian en la escuela, el menor es un bebé, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de tomates, venta de ropa, confección de tejidos, venta de fruta, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos y venta de pescado, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de embutidos como, jamón, mortadela, pasta de hígado, etc. Y lo realiza en su domicilio donde tiene una tienda de embutidos, su negocio carece de refrigerador por lo que tiene que comprar embutidos por menor para abastecer la venta diaria, esto le resta tiempo y gasta mucho en transporte, alguna vez sus productos se malograron por el calor intenso del lugar. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión con la compra de una heladera con mostrador, para mantener sus productos refrigerados y a la vista de los clientes, esto le ayudaría a realizar menos viajes y tener más tiempo para dedicarle a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Mayer solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su negocio comprando un refrigerador con mostrador y el tiempo que gane lo ocupara en compartirlo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mayer is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and has four children, ages 12, 9, 6, and 2. She works selling cold cuts. She is a good mother and an entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in “El Torno,” a place known for its great population growth due to the immigration of people from the country’s western region. The city has warm tropical weather and a temperature of 30°C [86°F].

Mayer has a dark complexion, and long black hair tied back. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish due to cultural reasons and because she uses it at work (she is standing in the center and is wearing a gray sweater and a black purse). She is married and her husband works in transport. Her three oldest children go to school, and the youngest one is still a baby. They own a brick house, which is served with electricity, drinking water and sewage.

She has a strong will to get ahead, which is why she led the creation of a communal bank where members have different activities, such as selling tomatoes, selling clothes, making dresses, selling fruits, selling empanadas, selling cosmetics and selling fish. This would help them to request loans and expand their businesses. Mayer sells cold cuts, such as ham, mortadella, and liver paste. She works at home, where she has a cold cuts store. She does not have a refrigerator, which is why she has to purchase small quantities in order to fulfill the daily demand. This results in a waste of time, expensive transport and even in ruined products because of the intense heat.

This is her third loan from the institution and she has been in business for three years. Her dream is to see her children become professionals. She would like to expand her business by buying a display refrigerator in order to store her products and be able to display them to customers. This will help her to decrease her transport and have more time for her family.

This is why Mayer is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a display refrigerator and be able to share more time with her children.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a display refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy amount of food and other goods for resale

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años de edad y un varón de 1 mes de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza para sostener a su familia apoyado en su venta de fruta partida la cual realiza de forma ambulante en los buses del transporte público desde hace 8 años. Oscar desea terminar de mejorar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar la mejora, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para mejorar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible y así brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 25, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  They have a five year old daughter and a one month old son.  He is a hard-working man who puts forth great effort to support his family.  He has been selling cut fruit in an itinerant manner on public transportation buses for eight years.

Oscar wishes to finish improving the walls and the floor of his house.  However, he does not have the financial fluidity needed to make the improvement.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, and gravel to make the improvement to the walls and floor of his house as soon as possible.  This way he will make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to make improvement to the walls and floor of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate, wood and nails to replace the roof of his kitchen.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more hogs and chickens needed in her business. She is glad that her earnings enabled her to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Lanie would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan to buy more pigs and chickens to slaughter and sell for her family's daily sustenance and her children’s education. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, hard work and the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year! 

Lanie dreams for her piggery and poultry farm to grow so she can give her family a prosperous life. She aims to send her children to school until college. Lanie faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional chickens and pigs needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university tuition fees and other university expenses.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Eloina es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrigerios.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, feliz, alegre, optimista, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Eloina es de tez morena, cabello negro corto crespo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que comparte con su familia, para el comercio habla español (la 3 de la izquierda, usa solera negro y pantalón rosa). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. La necesidad por darle un futuro mejor a su familia la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocio como; confección de carteras de cuero, servicio de transporte, venta de salteñas, confección de polleras, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas y venta de celulares, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerios a personal de oficinas dentro de  sus trabajos en horario de descanso; ella se encarga de preparar sándwiches de queso con mortadela, también de huevo, pollo, y otros como hamburguesas y sándwich de carne, durante el descanso a media mañana y a media tarde, entregando su producto debidamente empaquetado. “mi preparación comienza con el horneado del pan que lo realizo personalmente en un horno industrial que tengo instalado en un cuarto de mi casa…” comenta. Su sueño es abastecer de su comida a todas las oficinas y locales comerciales en horario de descanso. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de variedades de harina (de arroz, de maíz, etc) por quintal. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eloina solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harina por quintal para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eloina is a 54-year-old woman. She is married and has a 17-year-old son. She sells meals. She is a good mother and an entrepreneurial, joyful, cheerful, optimistic, cooperative, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in “El Torno,” a rural community located 45 minutes by car from the city [Santa Cruz de la Sierra], and known for its agricultural products, which attract farmers and businesspeople from the city. It has warm and humid tropical weather, with an annual temperature that ranges between 21 and 35 ºC [70-95 ºF].

Eloina has a dark complexion, and long black curly hair. Her and her family’s mother tongue is Guaraní, but she uses Spanish at work. She is the third one from the left and is wearing a black tank top and pink pants. Her husband works in the construction sector and her son goes to school. They own a brick house with corrugated iron roof, served with electricity. The water they use comes from a well. 

Thinking of a better future for her family, she led the creation of a communal bank, with members that work making leather purses, in the transport sector, selling meat pies, making skirts, renting videos, selling tableware and selling mobile phones. This would help them to request a loan and continue with their activities. She sells meals to people who work in offices, during their breaks. She sells cheese-and-mortadella, egg, beef, and chicken sandwiches, and hamburgers during the morning and afternoon breaks, properly wrapped. “I start by baking the bread, for which I use an industrial oven I have at home,” she says. Her dream is to supply all the offices and stores in the area during their breaks.

She wants to expand her business and buy different types of flour (e.g. rice and corn flour) by the quintal. This is her second loan with the institution, but she has been in business for thirty years.

This is why Eloina is requesting a loan to buy different types of flour by the quintal in order to fulfill her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy different types of flour by the quintal in order to fulfill her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in poles, electrical wire, a thermal circuit breaker, etc. to connect his house to the electrical grid.

loans.name: Kuapeguai Group

texts.es:
Yakelin es una mujer de 46 años, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 22, 17 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos y sándwiches.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, contante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por la diversidad cultural, etnias del lugar como la ‘Ayorea’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país se asentaron en el lugar, pero también llegaron familias afectadas por las sequías, cambas pobres (pobladores del oriente), collas (pobladores de occidente) nacidos en los más remotos rincones del país y fueron arribando al nuevo barrio guaraníes y chiquitanos entre muchas otras etnias. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yakelin es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro, viste pantalón y suéter negro). Su vida la realiza con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el mayor trabaja viven en casa de sus familiares que es propia y está construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina, cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tejido a máquina, servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, confección de polleras, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero y venta de salteñas, para solciitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y sándwiches. Los refrescos que vende son; gaseosas, jugos embotellados y jugos hervidos naturales elaborados en el lugar. Los sándwiches que vende son de carne de res, de pollo, de huevo con palta y fiambres. En un puesto de venta improvisado en las afueras de su domicilio, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día. “me animé a abrir mi negocio porque ví que alrededor no existe venta de comida, los clientes que atiendo son continuos porque viene a diario…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante propio, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes en mejores condiciones. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yakelin solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Yakelin is 46 year old woman, single, and has 3 children who are 22, 17, and 11 years old and her business is selling sodas and sandwiches. 
She is a good mother, enterprising, constant, responsible, and hardworking. She develop her business in an area called "Plan 3,000", which is known for it's cultural diversity including indigenous Ayoria people and miners who relocated to the west of the country and settled there. The area was also settled by families affected by the droughts, poor settlers from the east, poor people from the west who were born in the remotest corners of the country and who went to the new neighborhood of Guaraní and also Chiquitanos among many other ethnicities. The area has a hot, tropical climate with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade all year round. 
Yakelin has a dark complexion and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish in general and for her business. (In the photo, she is in the center, wearing pants and a black sweater). She lives with her children who are in school and the eldest works. They live in the house of some relatives, which is made of brick with a zinc roof and has drinking water, electricity, and city sewers. Her desire to overcome challenges lead her to become leader of the bank group comprised of people who run businesses such as: machine knitting, technical services, selling furniture, making chicken coops, selling quilts, making leather wallets, and selling empañadas. They are requesting a loan to grow their businesses. Her business is selling drinks and sandwiches. The drinks she sells are sodas, bottled juices, and natural drinks made in the area. The sandwiches she sells are beef, chicken, and egg with avocado and sausages. She sells from an improvised stall on the edge of her house. She does this every day of the week. "I decided to open my business because I saw there was nowhere selling food in the area. My customers come every day", she tells us. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She wants to grow her business by buying tables and chairs so that she can serve her customers in greater comfort. This is her second loan from the institution in 10 years of developing this business. 
It is for these reasons that Yakelin is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs so she can serve her customers in good conditions.

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
Rosejean is thankful that she received a 25,000 PHP loan which she used for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. Rosejean also operates a small general store for additional income. 

Rosejean would now like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle and to add some grocery items to her general store. Her two businesses help a lot in the family's daily sustenance and the children's school needs. Rosejean thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Rosejean dreams of buying another tricycle and growing her small general store. She prays for good health and for all her children to finish school to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her tricycle and to add some items to her small store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so as to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Universitario Group

texts.es:
Melina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 4 años, y su negocio es el corte y confección.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca a mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Melina es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  artesanía, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de sándwiches y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es el corte y confección de prendas de vestir femeninas, realiza; vestidos de fiesta, trajes de noche y arreglos a prendas como; largo del botapie, cintura de pantalón, ancho de caderas, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su taller de costura, Ella desea realizar la compra de tela de todo tipo por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Melina solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de tela por mayor para contar con material de trabajo.
texts.en:
Melina is a 39-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has an 8-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. She works making dresses. She is a good mother, and an entrepreneurial, independent, responsible, and hardworking woman. She works in the southern part of the city, where around a thousand artisans get together in the “La Alasita” fair to sell all kinds of miniature objects, which people hope will one day become real things. The city has very humid and warm tropical weather, with an annual temperature of around 30 °C [86 ºF].

Melina has a dark complexion. She is not very tall and has long, black braided hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, although she speaks Spanish because of cultural reasons and because she uses it at work. In the picture she is the one sitting. She lives with her partner, who works in the construction sector, and her children; her son goes to school and her daughter stays with her. She lives in a brick house with corrugated iron roof, served with electricity. The water they use comes from a well.

Thinking of expanding her business, she decided to start a communal bank with people that work selling groceries, meat, handicrafts, beverages, books, sandwiches and clothes. This will help them to request loans and improve their businesses. She works making clothes for women, such as party dresses and night dresses, and repairs clothes (e.g. length of the legs, waists, hips, etc.). Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

Melina wants to buy all kinds of fabrics in bulk, in order to have the material she needs all the time. This is her first loan with the institution in the ten years she has been in business.

This is why Melina is requesting a loan to buy different fabrics in bulk in order to have the materials she needs.

loans.use: to buy different types of fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: 73-Los Nuevos Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por ser el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, y por el comercio que realizan los descendientes de inmigrantes de etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello rojo largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de potable. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de hoja de coca, venta de polleras, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; poleras, soleras, mallas, bermudas, pantalones, cinturones, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle al aire libre. “la venta de ropa de segunda es accesible para todos por su precio y porque se utiliza para trabajar y vestir…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
María is a 32-year-old woman. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 12. She sells used clothes. She is a good mother, and an entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in an area called “plan 3000”, known for being the most populated neighborhood in the city, and for its commercial activities performed by people from ethnic groups such as the “Ayoreos” and miners that come from the west. This place has warm and humid tropical weather, with an average annual temperature of 30 °C [86 ºF].

María has a dark complexion. She is short and has long red hair tied back. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish due to cultural reasons and because of the work she does. She is the one sitting. She shares her life with her partner, who is a businessman, and her children, who go to school. She lives in a brick house with corrugated iron roof, served with electricity and drinking water.

Thinking of expanding her business, she took the initiative to start a communal bank with people who work selling coca leaves, skirts, quinoa juice, perfumes, beverages, ice cream and empanadas. This will help them to request loans and improve their businesses. She sells used clothes, such as skirts, tank tops, swimsuits, Bermuda pants, pants, and belts. She works every day as a street vendor. “Used clothes are affordable for everyone, because they are cheap and are used to go to work or do other activities,” she says.

Her dream is to have a clothing store. She wants to buy used clothes in bulk in order to fulfil her customers’ demands this season. This is her seventh loan in ten years she has been in business.

This is why María is requesting a loan to buy used clothes in bulk to fulfil her customers’ demands this season.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LAS ESTRELLITAS DEL SUR compuesta por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varon,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, mecánica,  venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

La presidenta del banco es la señora Flora es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos un varones de 8 años y dos mujeres de 12 y 4 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional Paceña.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Malianza, a 3.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Flora es de tez morena, cabello negro, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (Parada casi al final con blusa negra y chompa cafe). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la hicieron formar una banca de personas Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (carne de res, habas verdes, choclos y queso), Fricase de cerdo (sopa de cerdo con chuño, mote y papas), chairo paceño (sopa de chuño con carne) y otros. Oficio que aprendió desde muy niña cuando le ayudaba a su mamá. “la comida típica aún está latente en nuestra gente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda vender comida y brindar mayor  comodidad a su clientela. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carnes, fideos, otros, para cocinar durante esta epoca. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estar abastecida durante las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank Las Estrellitas del Sur is comprised of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man. They work in various roles including: selling fruits, selling juices, mechanic, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling food, and selling vegetables. They are requesting a loan to grow their businesses. 
The president of the bank, Flora, is a 32 year old woman who is married, has 3 children: an 8 year old boy, and 2 girls who are 12 and 4 years old. Her business is selling traditional Paceña food. 
She is a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, is committed to her work, and is responsible. She runs her business in the Malianza area, which is 3,800 meters above sea level.
Flora has a dark complexion, black hair, and is short. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish in general and for her business. (In the photo she is standing at the back wearing a black blouse and coffee-colored sweater.) She shares her life with her children who are in school. They live in their own home which has drinking water, electricity, and city sewers. Her desire to grow her business led her to form a bank group. Her business is selling traditional food such as: paceño (meat, green beans, corn, and cheese), fricassee of pig (a pig soup with dried potatoes, hominy, and potatoes), chairo paceño (dried potato soup with meat), and others. She learned to do this when she was very small when she used to help her mother. "traditional food is still eaten by our people..." she tells us. Her dream is to have a big restaurant where she can sell food and offer greater comfort to her customers. She wants to invest in her business by buying supplies in bulk such as: meat, pasta, and other things to cook during this season. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been developing this business.
This is why flora is requesting a loan to buy supplies to stock her business for the season.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es: Verónica de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer inteligente que hace 5 años al ver en su vivienda la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos económicos decidió instalar un molino de nixtamal, con el cual se gana la vida y logra estar pendiente de su familia. Verónica desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda ya que por lo delgado de las mismas no logran proteger a su familia cuando hay fuertes lluvias, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y mano de obra para repellar las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible y aprovechar la época seca para no tener inconvenientes en invierno.
texts.en:
Veronica, 25 years old, lives in her own home with her partner and two-year-old daughter. 

She's an intelligent woman who, faced with the need for more household income, decided to install a hominy mill at home five years ago. She earns a living through this work while keeping an eye on her family.

Veronica wants to plaster the walls of her home, they are thin and do not protect the family when there are strong rains.

She's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and labor costs for this project to be completed as soon as possible, taking advantage of the dry season to prevent issues in the winter.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and labor costs to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Raquel es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 21, 16, 9 y 6 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sincera, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘la Mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Raquel es de tez trigueña, cabello largo hasta los hombros color castaño, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la 3 de la izquierda atrás, usa blusa blanca floreada y bermuda negra con amarillo). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el mayor trabaja, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; poleras manga corta, bermudas, pantalones, cinturones, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día de forma ambulante en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “cada día me ubico en una feria o mercado diferente para variar la oferta a los clientes, algunos me buscan porque ya saben el dí que volveré…” comenta. Su sueño es aumentar su capital de trabajo para que sus hijos vendan con ella. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Raquel solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Raquel is a 39 year old woman who is married, has 4 children who are 21, 16, 9, and 6 years old, and who runs a business selling second-hand clothing.
She is a good mother, enterprising, sincere, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. She does her work in the Mutulalista area, a commercial area located in the center of the city and known for it's cluster of business offices. The climate is hot, tropical, and humid and has an approximate temperature of 21-35 degrees centigrade all day.
Raquel has dark gold skin and brown hair down to her shoulders. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish in general and for her business. (She is 3rd from the left in the photo, in a flowery white blouse and black and yellow bermudas). She shares her life with her husband who works in commerce and her kids, who are in school and the oldest one works. They live in a rented house made of brick that has electricity, drinking water, and city sewer supply. Her business is selling second hand clothing such as: short sleeved shirts, bermudas, pants, belts, and other items. She does this every day of the week during the day and sells from an open-air stall. "Every day I can be found in a different fair or market so that I can supply various customers. Some seek me out because they know what day I'll be there..." she tells us. Her dream is to increase her business capital so that her children can sell with her. She wants to buy second-hand clothes wholesale so that she can supply her customer's demands for the season. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has been running this business.
This is why Raquel is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing wholesale to supply her customers during this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for improvements to the floor and walls in her home.

loans.name: Viviana Joselyn

texts.es:
Viviana es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el tejido de chalecos para bebé.
Ella es emprendedora, de buena actitud, optimista, feliz, alegre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘cruce villa Adela’ un sitio céntrico, caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir movilidad a lugares alejados de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Viviana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lacio, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de su mamá que es propia y está construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas domiciliario. Su negocio es el tejido de chalecos para bebé, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años en un cuarto habilitado como taller de tejido, su hermana mayor le enseñó la actividad y trabajan juntas en el negocio. “mi ventaja es que mi hermana me ayuda a vender los tejidos y yo me dedico a realizarlos…” comenta. Su mayor dificultad es el tiempo que tarda en realizar los tejidos, su sueño es tener un taller grande y adecuado para su trabajo. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de maquinaria y lana por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Viviana solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para contar con material de trabajo para tejidos para bebé.
texts.en:
Viviana is a young single woman who has no children. Her business is weaving vests for children. She is enterprising, has a good attitude, optimistic, happy, cheerful, responsible and hard-working.

She does her business in the ‘Cruce Villa Adela’ area, a central area which connects the various parts of the city through public transportation. From this area you can get transportation to the farthest reaches of the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a daytime temperature which varies from 4 to 12 degrees Celsius throughout the year and is at an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level.

Viviana is dark-skinned, short in stature with long black straight hair. Her native language is Aymara which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the surrounding culture and in her business. She lives in the house that her mother owns which is built of abode with a metal roof and has potable water, electricity, sewage and cooking gas.

Her business is weaving vests for babies a business which she has been doing for 3 years in a room adopted to be a weaving workshop. Her older sister taught her this business and works with her in the business. "My advantage is that my sister helps me to sell the vests and I make them" she comments. Her main problem is the time it takes to do the weaving. Her dream is to have a large workshop adapted to her work.

She wants to make an investment in her business buying machinery and wool wholesale. It is for these reasons that Viviana is requesting a loan to buy wool wholesale to have raw materials to weave her clothing for babies.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale to have work material to make her clothing for children.

loans.name: Thongnoy Group

texts.en: Vixai is excited that the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Vixai and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Vixai and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Vixai and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Vixai and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and is married with 14 children, five of whom are still dependents and between nine and 17. She is from Estancia, Iloilo. Lucia is used to working hard because she has raised many children. To provide for her family, she has been engaged in multiple businesses such as aquaculture, making furniture, and operating a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Lucia is requesting a loan to buy hardwood to make doors for her store, as well as noodles, seasoning, shampoo, bath soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and sugar. She dreams of giving her children a good education and having and abundant life when she is old.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, noodles, seasoning, shampoo, bath soap, toothpaste, canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen de 32 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 13 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su hogar ya que desea brindar todo lo que está en sus manos para que su familia tenga lo mejor, es por ello que se gana la vida elaborando tamales de gallina los cuales vende en su cantón y los alrededores desde hace 10 años. Carmen desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que actualmente se la pasa un vecino y ella desea tener su propio servicio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, interruptores y toma corriente para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children, ages 13 and 4. She strives diligently to provide for her family, and aspires to provide the best for her family. Carmen has for the past 10 years sold chicken tamales in her neighborhood and the surrounding area. 

A neighbor of hers is currently having electricity installed in his home, and Carmen would like her family to enjoy its own electricity in their home. She's therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of  electrical wiring, a thermal breaker device, switches, and outlets for installation of electricity in her home. Once the installation is complete, Carmen and her family can enjoy a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase electrical wiring, a thermal breaker device, switches, and outlets for installation of electricity in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and married with a 14-year-old son. She is a businesswoman from Estancia, Iloilo. For the past five years, Rose has run a sari-sari (variety) business. She also operates a tricycle to transport passengers in her community.  

Rose is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy soft drinks, liquor, cigarettes, chips, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning. Her ultimate dream is for her son to graduate from college in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, cigarettes, chips, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from the town of Estancia in Iloilo. She is 44 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for seven  years. She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. In addition to this, she owns a tricycle that transports passengers for an income. 

She  is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. She will also buy spare parts like tire and bearings for her tricycle. 

With a loan, Mary Jane is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profits for the school fees of her eight-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for candies and toy products needed in her business. She is thankful that her earnings helped her to meet her family’s daily living expenses. 

Marilou is requesting another 50,000 PHP loan to buy large quantities of toy products, candies, and eco-bags to sell. She is thanking God and you in advance for this financial help and for a good return on her investment. Marilou’s loan will be a big help for her family’s daily sustenance and for the education of her child who is still in high school. 

Marilou dreams to grow her business and aims to for her child earn a college degree and have better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toy products and candies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 22 años de edad y su negocio es una tienda de barrio donde vende variedad de  alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es una persona  trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Villa Salome’ ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, de clima frio, con una temperatura ambiente entre 8 y 15 grados centígrados.
Victoria es de tez trigueña, cabello color negro rizado, habla español. su vida la comparte junto a su hija que estudia en la universidad como también le ayuda en el negocio, Viven en un departamento alquilado que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, huevos, galletas, leche, refrescos, agua, detergentes, etc. el negocio está ubicado en la avenida principal y por el lugar no existen otros negocios de este tipo, su negocio es muy conocido porque es bastante completo; “encontré un lugar donde no hay tiendas, eso fue el inicio, ahora tengo muchos clientes que me piden que amplíe mi negocio…”. Su sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad, y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de panetones y variedad de productos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Victoria is a single 43 year old woman who has a 22 year old daughter. Her business is a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of basic food items. She is s hardworking person.

Her business is located in the ‘Villa Salome’ area on the western slope of the city of La Paz. It has a cold climate with a temperature between 8 to 15 degrees Celsius. Victoria is wheat colored, with dark curly hair. She speaks Spanish and shares her life with her daughter who studies at university besides helping her in her store. They live in a rented apartment which has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her business is a neighborhood store that sells basic need food items like bread, sugar, eggs, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, water, detergents, etc. Her business is located on the main street and there is no competing business. Her store is well-known as it is fairly comprehensive. " To find a spot that had no stores that was the start. Now I have lots of clients who want me to expand my store".

Her dream is to have her own house in the city and wants to expand her business buying pants and a variety of products. This is her second loan with the institution in the two years she has been in business. For these reasons Victoria is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products wholesale to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a wall and cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Jelin

texts.en:
Jelin is a married woman with an eighteen-year-old son. She and her family live in Estancia, Iloilo. Life is not easy for her and her husband who works as a laborer. He does not earn much from his work and Jelin helps by selling rice and barbecue. 

She usually prepares pork and chicken barbecue in the evenings. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more rice, seasoning, meat, soy sauce, catsup and hot dogs. Jelin hopes that with all their hard work, her family’s life will become better.

loans.use: to buy rice, seasoning, meat, soy sauce, catsup and hot dogs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 45-year-old man from Estancia, Iloilo. He is married with three children ages 7, 9 and 14. Jose relies on making door mats and doing carpentry to provide for his family. He works hard for his children. 

He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy cloth for his door mats. This way he can produce more and deliver on time to his customers. Jose hope that he can increase profitability so he can continue supporting his children’s education. 

His income goes towards paying for his children’s education and providing a healthy diet for his family.

loans.use: to buy cloth for his door mats.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. She is 25 and is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Abel, who is a production man. Together with her husband, Mary Ann manages her own household and makes and sells “atsara” (the Filipino equivalent to pickle relish) and peanut butter. She works hard to augment her family’s income to meet their daily household expenses. Atsara is an appetizer made from grated unripe green papaya and often served as a side dish for friend and grilled foods like pork barbecue. Mary Ann’s peanut butter is also a favorite spread of the Filipino household. She sells per order and on demand for special occasions and holidays.  Mary Ann’s regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Mary Ann is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients such as green papaya, sugar, carrots, garlic, peanuts, oil and other items needed to make atsara and peanut butter. Her loan will help her continue with her business. Mary Ann is happy for the positive feedback about her relish and spread. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and financial help, for it surely will help meet her family’s daily personal and household needs.

In the future, Mary Ann aims to grow her business and she prays for constant love and harmony between her and her husband. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy green papaya, sugar, carrots, garlic, peanuts, oil and other items to make atsara and peanut butter

loans.name: Erlindo Ivan

texts.es: Erlindo de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 7, 20 y 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como albañil independiente, pero además cultiva la tierra para obtener ingresos extra dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Erlindo cuando llega de trabajar llega cansado, pero su vivienda es un solo cuarto por lo que vive en hacinamiento, por lo que desea construir un cuarto para poder tener un lugar donde descansar tranquilo y mejorando a la vez el hacinamiento en el que vive, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Erlindo, who is 34 years old, lives in his own home alongside his life partner and their 3 children, of ages 7, 20, and 2. He is a hardworking man who works as an independent carpenter, but he also farms the land to obtain extra income. He has been doing this for 10 years. When Erlindo gets home from work, he is tired, but his house only has one room. Because of this, he lives in overcrowded conditions. 

For this reason, he wants to build a room to be able to have a space to rest calmly, and to improve the overcrowding that he lives in.  To do this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room in his home. In this manner he can provide greater comfort to his family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, wire, iron, sheet metal, and nails to build a veranda and a fence in front of her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a fish vendor from Estancia, Iloilo. She is 51 years old and married, and has three dependents ages 11, 15 and 18. Using her bicycle with a side car, she sells fish to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell, thus increasing her profit for her family. It is her dream to be a good provider especially regarding the schooling of her children so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
Loryn is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store.  She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail.  She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings.  Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Loryn dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: iron, electrodes, iron plates, iron sheets, door locks, paint, pipe, etc.

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Héctor de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 10 años. Desde hace 5 años Héctor cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, pero él sabe que cada día salen más productos al mercado, por lo que él desea brindar la mayor variedad posible a su clientela, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: consomé, huevos, pan, queso, azúcar, café, leche, frijoles, arroz, etc. Para de esta manera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela buscando siempre estar en el gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en: Héctor, 43, has lived in his own home with his family for ten years. He has had a store selling basic products for five years. He knows that new products go on the market every day, so he would like to offer his clients the greatest variety possible. For this purpose, he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in broth, eggs, bread, cheese, sugar, coffee, milk, beans, rice, etc. to offer a greater variety of products to his clients. He is always looking to please his clients.

loans.use: to invest in broth, eggs, bread, cheese, sugar, milk, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a tortilla griddle, rice flour, pork rind, corn, fresh cheese, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: eggs, cheese, beans, sweet bread, coffee, rice, milk, snacks, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 30-year-old married woman from Leyte.  She has three young boys ages six to nine.  Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. Her husband works as a service crew member.  She plans to venture into hog raising but lacks the capital to do so.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and groceries to sell in her store.  In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business to support her family, and to save so she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para sostener a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de dulces artesanales la cual realiza en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas y por encargo desde hace 5 años. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos a los que ha logrado sacar adelante gracias a su esfuerzo. María desea invertir en su negocio ya que cuando tiene mayor cantidad y variedad de productos sus ventas son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: conservas de coco, de leche, de tamarindo, jaleas de nance, de tamarindo, coco rallado, etc. y de esta manera seguir sosteniendo su hogar y apoyando a sus hijos para que estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
María, 41, is an enterprising woman who works hard every day to support her family through her business selling homemade sweets. For five years, her business has been in an area with a large number of people and she also takes custom orders. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children, whom she has managed to raise thanks to her effort.

María would like to invest in her business because she has better sales when she has a larger quantity and variety of products. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in canned coconut, milk, tamarind, nance and tamarind jam, shredded coconut, etc. In this way, she will continue to maintain her household and support her children so that they can study and be good people.

loans.use: to invest in canned coconut, milk, tamarind, nance and tamarind jam, shredded coconut, etc.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es sincera, comprensiva, buena oyente, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la localidad de ‘el Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Dora es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que practica. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer, y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no está en edad escolar. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por el bien de su familia la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; elaboración de empanadas, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de polleras, venta de hoja de coca, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de helado, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; camisas, blusas, pantalones, jeans, poleras, camisetas, etc. Actividad que realiza durante el día, de lunes a domingo. “la ropa de segunda mano es barata y se encuentran buenas prendas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de ropa para dejar de seguir ambulando. Ella desea aprovechar las ventas de temporada para incrementar sus ventas mediante la compra y aumento de stock de ropa de segunda mano. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Dora solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer las ventas de temporada.
texts.en:
Dora is a 22 year old woman who lives with her spouse. She has 2 children 3 and 6 years old. Her business is selling secondhand clothing. She is sincere, understanding, a good listener and a good mother, enterprising, responsible and hardworking.

She does her business itinerantly in the rural community of 'el Torno’, located 45 minutes from the city by automobile. It is characterized by agricultural businesses which joins producing farmers with sellers and distributors from the city. The climate is hot, tropical and humid with a temperature that varies between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius daily throughout the year.

Dora is dark-skinned, with long, black, braided hair and short in stature. Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish because of the surrounding culture and in her business. She shares her life with her spouse who works as a driver and her children. The oldest studies in school and the youngest is not yet school-aged. They live in a rented apartment made out of brick, with a metal roof and has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her desire to improve for the good of her family lead her to head a group of people with businesses like: making empanadas, selling quinoa juice, selling chickens, selling cocoa leaves, selling perfume, selling soft drinks and selling ice-cream to request a loan to expand their businesses.

Her business is selling used clothing like shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, sweaters, t-shirts, etc. She works during the day from Monday to Sunday. " Secondhand clothing is cheap and you find good clothing", she comments. Her dream is to have her own store so she does not have to sell itinerantly. She wants to take advantage of the seasonal sales through buying and increasing her stock of secondhand clothing.

This is her second loan with the institute in the year she has had her business. For these reasons Dora is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothing wholesale to stock up for the season's sales.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing wholesale to restock for the season's sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, beams, and pins to build a roof and cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en: Mylyn is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 34 years old and married, and has two children ages seven and twelve.  For eleven years, she has been dependent on her income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Mylyn hopes she can expand her business in terms of inventory but she lacks funds. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stocks for her store like candies, biscuits, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs and coffee.
