loans.use: to buy assorted goods like canned goods, beverages, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Agripina to improve her business. Agripina lives in Ermera. She is 51 years old and married. She has four children.

Most of her daily income is from selling cows, so she is still happy to do her business. She started her business in 2005 with her own working capital of $2,000. With her husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow because it has become their activity.

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future, and she will have management for her business. She also cultivates animals in her place like cows and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is from the Island of Saiquijor. She is 33 years old and is married. Antonette owns and operates a fancy jewelry business, operating a specialized retail store selling fancy jewelry in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Antonette is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sari-sari store inventories.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sari-sari store inventory

loans.name: Lanette

texts.en: Lanette has signed up for her membership with PMPC and requested the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. Lanette is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phat makes traditional clothes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Adidja est commerçante, présidente du collectif d’affaires «Asifiwe», âgée de 36 ans, mariée à un menuisier mère de 5 enfants dont 4 étudient et 1est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse des braises. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la permettre d’accroitre ses activités et acheter 30 sacs braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en: Our client Adidja is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Asifiwe business group. She is 36 years old, married to a  carpenter, and the mother of five children, four of whom are in school and one is still very young. Adidja sells charcoal. She uses a charcoal storage facility in the business center of her town. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She has been in business for 12 years. This new loan will allow her to expand her business and buy 30 bags of charcoal. Thanks to her business, she would like to provide for her children's schooling, clothing and food. Finally, Adidja sincerely thanks Hekima for allowing female entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Deorita

texts.en:
Deorita lives in Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods such as eggs, biscuits, shampoo, seasonings, soap, bread, coffee and many others. She is a 54-year-old married woman with four grown children. Aside from that, she also engages in a tuba (coconut wine) vending business. 
 
She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items like canned goods, seasonings, beverages and toiletries. These will fill her store with various stock. In the long run, she will be able to sell more variety of stock to cater to the needs of her respective customers. With these, her daily earnings will increase and she will be able to manage her finances.

 Deorita dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, seasonings, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Nhóm 3-Khánh Cường 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Theu, pictured first from the left, is 47 years old. She works in the agriculture sector with a monthly income of VND 500,000. She is married with four children. She has been a member of local Women's Union since 1997. Due to the family's economic hardship, the family's latrine has been degraded seriously but they could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will build a hygienic toilet which will improve the quality of life for her family, and help her family and community avoid the diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Atamamao

texts.en: Atamamao is a 50-year-old mother of 2 children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over four years. Atamamao has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en:
Elenor owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, vinegar, mosquito repellant and powdered soap. She is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 5. Her husband earns a living by selling fish.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock for the store.  With this, her store will again be filled with a variety of stock. This will attract more buyers to come. She will be able to handle her finances and settle her obligations. She will provide her family with good food. 

Elenor hopes that she will properly handle her current source of income to become more productive and successful for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the store

loans.name: Nhóm 4-Khánh Cường 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hoai, 42, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 550,000. She is married with three children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1998.  Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation. They are still using a damaged toilet and cannot afford to have a hygienic one. With this loan, she will build a septic-tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to environmental protection. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 1-Khánh Cường 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mai, pictured first from the left, is 42 years old and employed in agriculture with a monthly income of about VND 650,000. She is married with two children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1997. Due to the lack of funds, her household does not have a sanitary latrine. Currently, the family's toilet has been damaged severely. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a septic tank to improve living conditions, improve the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Taase

texts.en: Taase is a 45-year-old mother of three children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Taase has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has experienced this for more than three years. Taase hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine

loans.name: Kiman

texts.en:
Kiman, 52 years old, lives in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has four children; one is single and lives under her support while the other three are married and live independently. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Nhóm 2-Khánh Cường 01 Group

texts.en: Luyen, 34, works as a farmer with a monthly income of about 560,000 VND. She is married with two young children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2009. Currently, her family experiences economic hardship and they don't have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Luyen will build a septic tank toilet. This will improve the living conditions of her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 53 year old mother of five children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Imeleta has requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, and a box of milk, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year, and hopes to expand her business using her business profit. Imeleta became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, and a box of milk

loans.name: Rosimeleane

texts.en: Rosimeleane is a 24-year-old mother of three children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Rosimeleane has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is a 53-year-old married woman. She has two children.  One of her sons (shown in the photo) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Chan has applied for a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for the growth of her son's business. Her son was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Nat’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto, de 53 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está separado de su compañera de vida desde hace tres años.- Por mucho tiempo se dedicó a la agricultura y la albañilería, pero tiene 15 años de trabajar como fontanero del sistema de agua de la comunidad.- Actualmente, vive solo pero siempre les ayuda a sus hijos de lo que gana. 

Adalberto, ha trabajado en el proyecto de agua de su comunidad por varios años, el proyecto beneficia a 900 familias; su horario de trabajo es todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Adalberto, necesita el dinero para comprar madera y pagar la mano de obra, para reparar la casa pues está en mal estado, con esto estará satisfaciendo su necesidad. 

El sueño de Adalberto es, tener en su casa a su familia, pues está reconciliándose con su esposa, por eso le urge tener una casa con las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Adalberto, 53 years old, studied through the third grade. He has been separated from his life partner for three years. He worked for a long time in farming and masonry but has worked for 15 years as a plumber for the community water system. He currently lives alone but always supports his children with what he earns. 

Adalberto has worked on his community’s water project for several years. The project benefits 900 families.  His work schedule is 7:00am to 4:00pm. 

Adalberto needs the money to buy wood and to pay labor costs for repairing his home. It is in bad shape and with this he would be meeting his needs.

Adalberto’s dream is to have his family in his home. He is reconciling with his wife for which she is urging him to have a home in good condition.

loans.use: to buy wood and pay the labor costs to repair his home.

loans.name: Melekuini

texts.en: Melekuini is a young mother of two children. She is 20 years old and runs a small business selling chinese cookies in her community to earn a living. Melekuini has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a box of mushroom soy sauce, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a gas stove to run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years and hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a box of mushroom soy sauce, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a gas stove

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en: Rabina is 50 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. One of their sons runs a vehicle repair shop to meet the family's expenses. He provides different services including denting and painting of different vehicles. For the improvement of her son’s business, Rabina availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way, her son was able to purchase more spare parts, tools and tires of good quality to cater to more customers to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts, tools and tires of good quality to cater to more customers to earn more income.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 20-year-old mother with one child. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year and hopes to use her profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for family needs. Matalena became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en: Van’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Van makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and seller by selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango, junto a esposa y sus dos hijos, él tiene 27 años de edad. 
Elias para la generación de sus ingresos, trabaja como empleado en una barbería, este trabajo lo aprendió observándolo con sus amigos, pues con el pasar del tiempo el logro conseguir trabajo,  para Elías es un trabajo muy bonito y lo que más le gusta es atender a los niños. Pues en la comunidad donde vive Elias no existe mucho trabajo, esta es una de las razones  el por qué  él trabaja fuera de su comunidad,  pues para llegar a tiempo debe madrugar todos los días al igual la regresada no tiene un horario fijo de culminar la jornada  ellos dependen mucho de la demanda de la gente. 
Pues en  varias ocasiones a  Elias se  le dificulta regresar porque ya no consigue transporte, entonces para mantener su trabajo y estar sereno para regresar a su casa, es tener un medio como transportar, pues él ha decidió buscar un prestamo para comprarse una motocicleta, este prestamo lo estaría pagando con el apoyo de su esposa,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica. Pues con este ingreso su esposa le estaría ayudando  en cubrir algunas necesidades de su familia mientras Elias con una parte de su ingreso estaría  pagando el prestamo. Y  el sueño más grande de Elias  con las experiencias adquiridas como empleado es poner algún día  su propia barbería.
texts.en:
Elias lives in the community of Chichicastenango, along with his wife and two children. He is 27 years old.

To generate income, Elias works as an employee at a barber shop. He learned this profession by observing with his friends, and with time, he was able to secure a job. For Elias, it is a very nice job, and what he enjoys most is serving children.

In the community where Elias lives, there is not much work. This is one of the reasons for which he works outside his community. To arrive on time, he gets up early every day, and he does not have an established return time. The end of his work day varies because they depend a lot on the customers' demand.

Much of the time, it is hard for Elias to return because he can't find transportation. To maintain his position and not worry about how to return home, the solution is to have his own mode of transportation. He decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle.

He will pay off the loan with the support of his wife. She makes traditional clothing for a living. With this income, his wife will help cover some of the family's necessities while Elias can put a part of his income toward paying back the loan.

Elias' greatest dream is to use his experiences gained as an employee to one day open his one barber shop.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Dina Yaneth

texts.es: Dina de 39 años de edad vive en casa en propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la compra-venta de chatarra desde hace 6 años, su negocio está cerca de su casa y posee muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de bronce, aluminio, hierro, cartón, papel, etc.  para seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dina is 39 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband and three children. For 6 years now, she has bought and sold scrap for a living. Her business is near her house, and she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bronze, aluminum, iron, cardboard, paper, etc. so she can continue her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase bronze, aluminum, iron, cardboard, paper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in her business to procure sales which will allow her to support her children's college education.

loans.name: Datu Group

texts.en:
Christina is aged 33, married, and has got two children who are at school. She has been supporting her family by running two businesses; grocery selling beer,soda,water, and juice. Chicken feed is her second business; she has been in these businesses for four years now. She starts working from 8:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second credit request to be apportioned among DATU with two group members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous credit and paid it back successfully to buy beer,soda,juice, and water, together with chicken feed for her shop. She managed to receive a small extra income which she used to buy a small wheelbarrow for carrying shop luggage. She paid part of her school fees and household expenses. She is so thankful for your support to her business. In the coming years, she would like to manage another business of electronic fund transfer (Mpesa,Tigo pesa).
With her credit request, she will invest to buy stock of drinks for her grocery store, and chicken feed to resell.

loans.use: to buy stock of drinks for her grocery store, and chicken feed to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a resident of Mayorga, Leyte. She is 41-year-old woman with three kids aged 7,5, and 3 years old. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like beverages,sugar,shampoo eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, and toiletries. Aside from that, she engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. Her husband earns a living  by being a pedicab driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store, and farm supplies like fertilizers. These are  helpful in augmenting higher earnings. These will attract more buyers. Her farm will have higher volume of yield. With these, she could start to handle her finances.

 
Jocelyn dreams  that someday, she could expand her business and she is hoping to have her own capital to become productive and sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store, and farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Deborah has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 11 years selling to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by selling piped water and a retail shop. She works from home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a fully stocked retail shop so as to stop selling charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sacristins Group

texts.fr: Masika est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Sacristins, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 9 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés  au marché central de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter 3 ballons de souliers. Son conjoint est un agent de l’Etat. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Masika is a trader and the president of the Sacristins Group, who work with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 48 years old, married and mother to nine children who all attend school.  

Masika started her business with money provided by her husband, who works for the authorities.  She has been selling second-hand shoes at the central market in the town, for eight years.  She will use her loan to buy three bundles of shoes for resale.

In the future, Masika would like to take out more loans and be able to feed and educate her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support that they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 3 bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Générosité Group

texts.fr: Kamate est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Générosité», client de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 35 ans, mère 3 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de pagnes Super wax au marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter 25 pièces de pagnes. Elle souhaite renforcer son capital, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kamate is a trader and the treasurer of the loan group 'Générosité' (Generosity), who work with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 35 years old, divorced and mother to three children who all attend school.  She began her business with money provided by her husband.  She has been selling Super wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) at the town market for ten years.

Kamate will use her loan to buy 25 pagnes for resale.  She would like to increase her working capital, build a house, feed and educate her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 25 pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Les Citadins Group

texts.fr: Mukanirwa est commerçante, membre  de la banque villageoise Les Citadins, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 10 enfants  tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés  au marché central de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 5 ballons de souliers. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mukanirwa is a trader and member of the loan group 'Les Citadins', who work with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 46 years old, married and mother to ten children who all attend school.  She began her business with money provided by her husband who also works as a trader.

Mukanirwa has been selling second-hand shoes at the central market in the town for five years.  She will use her loan to buy five bundles of shoes for resale.

In the future, Mukanirwa would like to continue working with the field partner, educate and feed her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support that they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with two children and both her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Irene operates a retail shop in a space that she rents. She has been in this business for 11 years. She works seven days a week. Irene has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, and boxes of soap and sugar. Her major business challenges include defaulters, thieves and the ever-increasing prices of her products. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, cooking oil, and boxes of soap and sugar

loans.name: Akili Group

texts.fr: Madame FATUMA est mariée à un pasteur et mère de 8 enfants, tous écoliers. Agée de 54 ans, elle est vendeuse de braise au marché central et Présidente du groupe AKILI.  Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui servira d’acheter 95 sacs de braise et payer le transport afin de subvenir aux besoins éducatifs de ses enfants.Son reve est de prosperer dans ses affaires et pour cela, elle remercie grandement HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Fatuma is 54 years old, married to a pastor and is mother to eight children who all attend school.  She sells charcoal at the central market and is the president of the Akili Group.  She has requested this loan in order to buy 95 sacks of charcoal and pay for transport.  In this way she hopes to be able to pay for the schooling of her children.

Fatuma's dream is to be successful in her business and she is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to buy 95 sacks of charcoal and pay for transport.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: Maman BUGANDA, présidente du groupe UTULIVU est mère de 7 enfants tous allant à l’école. Agée de 47 ans et mariée à un chômeur, elle s’occupe de vente des produits divers. Elle vient de demander un pret qui lui  permettra d’acheter 50kg de farine, 10 litres d’huile, 5kgs de sucre, les braise et les ingrédients de cuisine pour lui permettre de faire étudier ses enfants et de renforcer son système d’épargne. Ainsi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en:
Buganda is the president of the Utulivu Group.  She is 47 years old, married to an unemployed man, and mother to seven children who all attend school.  She sells a wide range of products.

Buganda has requested this loan to buy 50 kgs of flour, 10 litres of oil, 5 kgs of sugar, charcoal and other cooking ingredients.  Selling these will enable her to pay for her children's schooling and increase her savings.

She is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima for the support they offer to very low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 50 kgs of flour, 10 litres of oil, 5 kgs of sugar, charcoal and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Maaoleava

texts.en: Maaoleava is a 21-year-old mother of three children. She operates a small business providing transportation services to people to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Maaoleava has requested a loan to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, and new wheels to help her maintain her good services. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and provide for her family's needs. Maaoleava joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, and new wheels,

loans.name: Hern's Group

texts.en: Hern’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Sokhorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hazina Group

texts.fr: La cliente MIHIGO, présidente du groupe HAZINA est mère de 7 enfants et mariée à un agent de l’Etat. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usés au marché central depuis 2005 suite au fonds de roulement provenant de son mari. Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 11 douzaines de sandales et payer le transport. Son vœu est de voir payer les études de ses enfants et agrandir sa maison. De ce fait, elle remercie HEKIMA pour tout.
texts.en:
Mihigo is the president of the loan group Hazina.  She is married to a man who works for the authorities and mother to seven children.  She began her business with money provided by her husband.

Mihigo has been selling second-hand shoes at the central market in the town since 2005.  She will use her loan to buy eleven dozen pairs of sandles and pay for transport.

In the future, Mihigo's wish is to educate her children and extend her house.  She is very grateful to Hekima for all the support that they offer.

loans.use: to buy 11 dozen pairs of sandles and pay for transport.

loans.name: Branca

texts.en:
Branca lives in Ermera. She is married and has five children. She is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as sugar, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Branca has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income every day because many people like to buy from her. So she is still happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run her business in a bigger store. She also has animals like cows, goats, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 22-year-old with two children. She runs and operates a small business providing services to people by cutting grass to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than two years. Julie has requested a loan to buy a lawn mower, celluloid, safety boots, safety uniform, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide a good service to people. Julie became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower, celluloid, safety boots, safety uniform, and hand gloves

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a 47-year-old mother of four children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has had experience doing this for more than eight years. Rosalia has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a 58-year-old mother of four children. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. Faavae has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than five years. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for her family's needs. Faavae became a member of SPBD in 2002.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure.

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en: Sreyleak’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreyleak makes a living by cultivating rice and does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yen makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She is married and her husband is a teacher. She has five children and a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as slippers, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, bread, a refrigerator, fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, water and trousers.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Adelina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, bread, a refrigerator, fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, water and trousers.

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en: Bo’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Bo makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Antonia (es la señora que aparece al lado derecho de la foto) es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años y el otro de 9 años ambos estudian en la escuelita de su comunidad, Antonia tienen28 años de edad.
 
Antonia es una mujer que lucha cada día para la generación  de sus ingresos, ella se dedica a la compra venta de ropa típica, ella por ahora únicamente vende en el mercado de su comunidad, una de las razones por que no vende en lugares aledaños, es porque no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar más mercadería. A raíz de este dificultad, Antonia anda en busca de un prestamo, para comprar más mercadería y así poder generar más ingresos y sobre todo ganancias, Ella no cuenta con otro ingreso pero con esta venta ella manifiesta que  es  eficaz. 
La meta de Antonia para el futuro de acuerdo a sus ganancias ella puede buscar otros mercados para vender y generar más ganancias, y tener diversidad de cortes y güipiles a la moda, ya que el mundo es cambiante y cada  día modernizan los productos. Antonia tiene la plena seguridad de conseguir el prestamo y su sueño llegara hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Antonia (the lady on the right side of the photo) is a married woman who is 28 years old and has two children, one who's 8 and another who's 9.  Both are students in the small school in their community.  

Antonia is a woman who toils daily to generate her income.  She buys and sells traditional clothing for a living.  At the moment, she only sells in the marketplace in her community.  One of the reasons she doesn't sell her wares in adjoining areas is because she doesn't have enough money to buy more merchandise.  Due to this problem, Antonia is in search of a loan to buy more merchandise and thus be able to generate more income and, most importantly, profit.  She doesn't have any other source of income, but says that her business in sales is efficient.

Antonia's goal for the future, in accordance with her earnings, is to look for other markets to sell in and generate more profit, and to have a variety of fashionable skirts and dresses as the world is constantly changing and products are updated every day.  Antonia has complete confidence that she'll receive this loan and that her dream will be made a reality.

loans.use: stock up on traditional clothing for resale

loans.name: Ashuza Group

texts.fr: La cliente CINAMA est trésorière du groupe ASHUZA et vendeuse des souliers grâce au fonds de démarrage reçu de son mari à l’âge de 45ans. Mère de 8 enfants tous allant à l’école, elle vient de demander un crédit qui lui servira d'acheter 16 paires de souliers. Elle compte construire une maison dans les jours à venir et renforcer son système d’épargne. A cet effet, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en:
The client, Cinama, is the treasurer of the Ashuza group. She sells shoes thanks to the startup funding she received from her husband when she was 45. She has eight children who all go to school. 

She just requested a loan that will help her buy 16 pairs of shoes. She would like to build a home in the days to come and strengthen her savings system. To this effect, she would like to thank Hekima for their support.

loans.use: buy 16 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, de 50 años de edad, logró estudiar segundo año de educación básica, está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda, tiene tres hijos y todos ya tienen sus propias familias.

Cristino, es empleado en la alcaldía de su municipio, trabaja como seguridad pública. En los días  libres le ayuda a atender el negocio familiar a su compañera de vida.- En la alcaldía, trabaja un día y el siguiente es día libre. Su lugar de trabajo está a 10 km de su casa y viaja en bus, anteriormente se dedicaba a las actividades agrícolas con su padre y hermanos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción y mercadería para el negocio, con esta inversión su local será más amplio y podrá tener mejores ingresos, porque sus ingresos como empleado son bajos y no es a tiempo completo, por eso tuvo que buscar otras fuentes de ingresos, para llevar el sustento a su familia.

Cristino, desea que su negocio crezca y que sea rentable, para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristino is 50 years old and has a second-grade education. He has a partner, a businesswoman who owns a small shop, and together the couple has three children, now adults and with their own families.

Cristino works at the local town hall as a security officer every two days. On his free days he works at his partner's shop. Cristino's security job is ten kilometres from his house; he arrives there by bus. Previously Cristino worked in farming with his father and brothers.

Cristino needs this loan in order to buy building materials and merchandise for his partner's business. This investment will make the shop larger and Cristino can earn a higher income. Cristino's wages from the security work are low. He is not full-time and so had to look for another income to support his family. 

Cristino wants to expand the business and make it profitable in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and merchandise for a business.

loans.name: Jairo David

texts.es:
Jairo, a sus 40  años de edad, es una persona afectada por nivel de desempleo que tiene el país actualmente, sin embargo, esto no lo detiene y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante y conseguir sus propios ingresos. 

Por esta razón desea abrir un negocio donde criara cerdos para la venta, así aprovechará la ventaja que posee de vivir en una finca muy transitada, es por ello, que ve en esta idea de negocio una fuente de ingresos favorable. 

Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito, con la idea de invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, alimentos y materiales para la construcción de una cochera para albergarlos para darle inicio a su proyecto, con el cual espera generar los recursos necesarios para apoyar a su familia con la economía del hogar. 

Jairo sueña con fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo cada día más rentable y productivo, que le brinde la oportunidad de tener una estabilidad económica y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Jairo has been affected by the current unemployment levels in his country. This is not holding him back, however, as he is on the lookout for opportunities that will allow him to get ahead and earn his own income.

To do this, Jairo wants to open a business raising pigs to sell. He can thus take advantage of the fact that he lives on much-frequented land and sees the opportunity to have earn a good income.

This has motivated Jairo to apply for a loan in order to buy pigs, feed and materials to build and shed to house the pigs. This will be a start to the project that Jairo hopes will provide him with the necessary income to support his family and the household income.

Jairo dreams of making his business stronger, more profitable and more productive. He wants it to give him financial stability and allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and materials to build a space to house the pigs.

loans.name: Yanilis Maria

texts.es:
Yanilis es una mujer de campo y madre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Yanilis is from the countryside and is a mother of two children. She has had to face many difficulties in life but has always had the strength to move forward and continue progressing with her family.

For some time now, Yanilis has wanted to start a business raising and selling chickens. As a result she is applying for financial help to buy some chickens to raise, and materials to build a coop.

With this new business, Yanilis will be able to generate an income for her family, the most important thing to her, and improve her husband and children's quality of life.

Yanilis will work every day to drive her business forward and make it a sustainable and profitable business.

Support a hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens to raise, and materials to build a coop.

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
Antonio es casado de 39 años de edad, vive en una comunidad  denominada las palmas, con su esposa y sus tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian en el nivel primario. 
Antonio (señor que aparece al lado derecho de la foto) es un padre que trabaja incansablemente, para mantener a su familia, él para generar sus ingresos se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de abarrotes y entre otros productos comestibles, con la amabilidad en que atiende a la gente y por los años de negocio es un tiendero muy conocido y visitado, Antonio  quiere sobresalir  con la tienda, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para su inversión, pues la salida más viable es buscar un prestamo para poder equipar su tienda, basándose de la demanda de sus compradores. 
Antonio además de la tienda él también tiene un molino de Nixtamal, este también le genera ingresos con estas dos actividades él ha sacado avante a su familia y ha podido  satisfacer otras necesidades en beneficio de su familia. Antonio sus metas para el futuro es ver su tienda más grande y con las ganancias, construirá una casa más para sus hijos. Antonio tiene expectativas de conseguir el prestamo, el necesita tres mil quetzales.
texts.en:
Antonio is married, 39 years old, lives in a community called 'Las Palmas' with his wife and three children, two of which attend elementary school. 
Antonio (the gentleman on the right in the photograph) is a father who works tirelessly to support his family. To generate an income, he has been working for 10 years in the sales of groceries among other edible products. Due to the kindness he treats people with and to his years in the business, he is a well known and visited shop keeper. 

Antonio wants to excel with his shop, but does not have enough capital to invest, so the most viable option is to seek out a loan to be able to equip his shop, basing himself on the demands by his clientele. 
Besides his shop, Antonio also has a corn mill, which also generates income. With these two activities, he has provided for his family and been able to meet other family needs.

Antonio's goals for the future is to see his shop expand and with the profits, he will build another house for his children. Antonio has expectations of obtaining the three thousand quetzal loan he needs.

loans.use: purchase groceries.

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está casado y su esposa se dedica a atender este negocio.- Hace algún tiempo atrás emigro a Estados Unidos, buscando mejores oportunidades de trabajo, pero lamentablemente al poco tiempo de estar allá, fue deportado y tuvo que regresar de nuevo al país; con el dinero que ahorro coloco un negocio de venta de comida. 

José, trabajo mucho tiempo en la agricultura junto a su padre, luego realizó trabajos como albañil.- Actualmente, tiene un negocio de venta de comida, este negocio lo atienden de lunes a sábado.

El dinero lo invertirá para comprar maíz y otros insumos para su negocio, aprovechando el descuento que le hacen por la compra en mayoreo.

Su sueño es, ver que sus dos hijas culminen sus estudios y sabe que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo podrán lograrlo.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and has a sixth grade education. He is married; his wife works at José's business.

Some time ago José emigrated to the United States in search of better opportunities. Unfortunately, after only a short time there, he was deported and had to return to El Salvador. With money that he saved there, José started a business selling meals.

For a long time José used to work in farming with his father. He then worked as a builder and now has a business selling meals. He works at this business Monday to Saturday.

This loan will be used to buy corn and other supplies for his business. He will take advantage of bulk-buying discounts.

José's dream is to see his two daughters finish their studies. He knows that with a lot of hard-work they can do it.

loans.use: to buy corn and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Malina

texts.en: Malina is 52 years old with two children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Malina has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profit. Malina joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Rominar

texts.en:
Rominar is 58 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her three children. She has been selling food and drink over five years to increase the family income. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve a better life.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 6,500,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children and two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, rice and bread. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, rice and bread

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en: Kea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sreynin's Group

texts.en: Sreynin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sreynin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a traditional clothes maker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She also cares for additional family members. She has operated a retail food stall at the market for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, and onions. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonal changes and transportation. She wants to become a wholesaler and buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice and potatoes.

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio sigue dedicándose a brindar  el servicio de transporte interprovincial, el socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio desea continuar trabajando y mediante sui trabajo poder apoyar a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca Terminal", located in the district of Cusco.

The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. He is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

He is a responsible and diligent man. He wants to continue doing this job to be able to support his family. 

He requests this loan to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She has operated a home-based restaurant for five years. She has applied for 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy green bananas, flour, beans, beef, and cooking oil. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include changing weather conditions and transportation. She would like to buy better serving dishes so as to attract more customers. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, flour, beans, beef, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste is requesting a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. There are six members in the family, including her four children and her husband. She is a businesswoman so she wants to take this loan to add to her working capital and then she will use it to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, including notebooks, condiments, cooking oil, cigarettes, toothpaste, batteries, balm, biscuits, gambling cards and other things to sell. She is still happy to do her business because every day many people come to shop in her store. She is taking this loan because she wants to improve her management and to increase her income in the future. Celeste has been involved in business activities since 2010. She started with her own working capital of $ 1,500. She also raises animals like cows, pigs and dogs in her place.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, condiments, cooking oil, cigarettes, toothpaste, batteries, balm, biscuits, gambling cards and other things to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with two children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Edna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myla works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Myla has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián, de 67 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está viudo y sus hijos ya están a acompañado, solo uno vive con él, pero trabaja y cubre sus gastos.

Sebastián, se dedica a la agricultor, desde muy pequeño se a dedicado a esa actividad, ya que lo aprendió de sus padres.- Él, viaja todos los días al terreno por la mañana a ver los cultivos, su medio de trasporte es una bicicleta.

El crédito será utilizado para pagarle a personas que le ayuden para cortar la cosecha y comprar madera y lamina para mejorar su casa.

Los sueños de Sebastián son, poder mejorar su vivienda y comprar terneras para crecerlas y lleguen a ser vacas.
texts.en:
Sebastián, who is 67 years old, studied until the 4th grade.  He is a widow and his children are already coupled-up, only one of them still lives with him, but he works and covers his own costs.  Sebastián makes a living working in agriculture; since he was very little he dedicated himself to this activity as he learned this trade from his parents. 

He travels every day to his space of land in the morning to see his crops.  He travels by bicycle.  He will use the loan to pay the people that help him cut the crops and also to buy wood and sheets to better his house.  Sebastián's dreams are to be able to better his home and to buy calves to raise them so that they become cows.

loans.use: to pay people to help them cut the crops and to buy wood and sheets to improve their house

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 56 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive con sus 4 hijos de 22, 20, 18 y 13 años de edad desde hace varios años.  Él es un hombre responsable que sabiendo la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, y siempre tratando de darles lo mejor decidió dedicarse a la venta de billetes de lotería, los cuales le han dado muy buen resultado, ya que gracias a ello ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar desde hace 24 años. El negocio de José es muy rentable sobre todo porque el recorre las calles de diferentes municipios para ofrecer sus productos, por lo que desea invertir más en su mercadería y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en más billetes de lotería y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José, 56, is a hard-working man who lives with his four children, ages 22, 20, 18 and 13.  He is a responsible person who knows how necessary it is to provide for his children.  He always has tried to give them the best he could and decided to go into business selling lottery tickets, which has given him a very good profit, allowing him to support the household for 24 years.

José's business is very profitable because he goes all up and down the different municipal streets offering his product.  He wants to buy more tickets and is requesting a loan through FUSAI so he can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Yucedith

texts.es:
Yucedith es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de café bar

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

Con este negocio podrá costear sus estudios además de poder tener un ingreso para su sostenimiento y el de su hogar.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas, un congelador y surtido de cervezas.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una joven llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Yucedith is a very enterprising, creative woman who has wanted to be independent and have her own cafe bar for a long time.  Now she can carry out her dream thanks to her great work capacity and the support received through Corporación Interactuar, as well as the people who want her to succeed in her business.  This activity allows her to pay for her studies and also earn extra income for herself and her household.

The loan she is requesting is to buy chairs, tables, a freezer and a variety of beers.  

You can help this young, lively woman and give her family a boost with your loan!

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, a freezer and a variety of beers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wire, nails and hire workers to build a front porch.

loans.name: Amigas 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, dos varones de las edades de 8 y 5 años, dos mujeres de 22 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes, regalos  y productos de temporada.
Ella es buena madre, cariñosa, sensible, y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de Julio’ un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; en esta zona se lleva a cabo la feria mas grande de Suramérica ya que puedes encontrar desde una aguja hasta un auto. De clima frio con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -3 hasta15 grados centígrados.
Maribel es una mujer de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, habla español por cultura general (la segunda de la derecha, usa pantalón color café,  blusa negra y chompa ploma). Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos y su esposo quien le ayuda en esta actividad; vive en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado Su negocio es la venta de productos de temporada. La temporada de navidad se acerca y los productos más vendidos son los juguetes, ella ofrece juguetes de tipo aprendizaje, como; ladrillos para armar, libros de pintar, cubos de letras, rompecabezas, etc. Como también regalos para matrimonios,  “compro productos según a la temporada y me va bien ya que tengo clientela…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un almacén y distribuir al por mayor, Ella desea realizar la compra de regalos y juguetes por mayor para satisfacer la demanda del mercado por la temporada de navidad.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita un préstamo para la compra de regalos y juguetes para satisfacer la demanda de la época de navidad.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and has four children: two sons aged 8 and 5, and two daughters aged 22 and 16. She sells toys, presents and other seasonal products. She is a good, affectionate, understanding and hardworking mother. She works in an area called “16 de Julio,” known for its fast population growth, and also because there is where the largest fair in South America takes place, where one can find from a needle to a car. This place has cold weather, with temperatures ranging from -3 to 15 °C [27-59 ºF].

Maribel has a dark complexion. She is short and has long black hair. She speaks Spanish due to cultural reasons (she is the second one standing, right to left, and is wearing brown pants, a black blouse and a gray sweater). She shares her life with her children and her husband, who works with her. They live in a house they own, served with drinking water, electricity and sewage. She sells seasonal products. The Christmas season is coming and the most sought-after products are toys. She sells educational toys such as building blocks, painting books, letter cubes, and jigsaw puzzles. She also sells wedding presents. “I buy products, depending on the season. I am doing well, since I have a good customer base,” she says.

Her dream is to have a store and become a wholesaler. She wants to buy presents and toys in bulk in order to satisfy her customers’ demands during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy toys and other products to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 26 y 19 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, responsable, constante, fuerte y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Pampachililaya’ del lago sagrado Titicaca; lugar donde se encuentra el albergue comunitario; sitio donde se puede descansar para después abordar los botes a motor rumbo a la Isla, el trayecto a la isla en bote se realiza a través de laberintos de Totora (planta acuática típica del lago), con paisajes maravillosos. 
Bertha es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor porque el mayor es independiente, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la pesca, cada día al salir el sol; ella junto a su hijo se adentran al lago Titicaca y realizan la pesca de; carachi, mauri, ispi y trucha. “la pesca del lugar es muy popular porque las especies de peces son muy demandadas por el sabor de su carne…” comenta. Su labor es bastante sacrificada porque el clima del lugar; es frio y los rayos solares bastante fuertes. Ella sueña en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar la compra de un bote de pesca nuevo porque el que tiene esta viejo y no brinda las condiciones de seguridad. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 24 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca nuevo para mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Martha is a fisherwoman. She is 49 years old, single and has 2 sons, one is 26 and the other 19 years old. She is a good mother, independent, responsible, perseverant, strong and hardworking.

She works in the local community of Pampachililaya, in Titicaca sacred lake. There is a community shelter there, where fishers can rest before boarding the motorboats and setting off to the island. On their way to the island, the boats go through Totora labyrinths (aquatic sedge typical of the lake) and marvellous landscapes can be seen.

Martha is a short woman of dark complexion, she has long black hair that she wears braided and she dresses in the traditional manner (blanket, skirt and hat). Aymará is her mother tongue and she uses Spanish for commerce.

She shares her life with her younger son, because the oldest one is independent. They live in their own house made of adobe with a thatched roof, it has electricity and well water.

She works as a fisher. Every day when the sun rises, she and her son go into Titicaca lake to fish carachi, mauri, ispi and trout. "Fishing here is very popular because these species are highly demanded for the flavour of their meat" she says. The work is hard and demanding due to the cold weather and harsh sunlight.

She wishes to improve her family's living conditions. She wants to buy a new fishing boat because the one she has is old and doesn't meet the basic safety requirements. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy a safer boat. This is her third cycle of loans with the institution in the 24 years she has had this occupation.

loans.use: to buy a safer fishing boat.

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a su familia.

Es una mujer muy aplicada y trabajadora y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, estantería y compra de inventario en productos de la canasta familiar.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su familia (Ver Foto) todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar su estudio y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una madre emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Diana is a woman with a lot of energy and a good attitude to take on any challenge and overcome it.  She wants to open a grocery store to earn an income to support her family.  She is a hard-working person with much drive and a desire to get ahead and become a professional.

She is requesting a loan to buy a display case and shelving and to buy a stock of basic food products.

With this loan she will be able to realize her dream of being independent and giving her family (in the photo) everything they need.  She also will be able to pay for her studies and prosper thanks to support from Kiva and Corporacion Interactuar.

Support the project of a Colombian entrepreneur!

loans.use: To buy a display case, shelving and basic food products.

loans.name: Les Bonnes Volontes (1) Group

texts.es:
Valence is a member of the community bank group LES BONNES VOLONTES (1), and helps lead a subgroup of eight other micro entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For the last ten years, Valence has run his own business: a drinks depot in Brazzaville. The father of three young children, Valence has big dreams to send his children to the best schools in Brazzaville. In order to have the money to do so, Valence wants to grow his business. 

In 2014, Valence joined LES BONNES VOLONTES (1) at HOPE Congo to grow his business. Now on his third loan cycle, Valence would like to take out a loan of 350,000 CFA to purchase addition capital: 15 cases of drinks to sell to restaurants around Brazzaville. The main challenge for Valence’s depot is when problems occur in the bottling factory, causing a rupture in his stock. In order to prevent this, Valence often keeps back a few  extra drink flavors to better serve his clientele. In the future, Valence hopes to become exclusive with one of the drink factories near Brazzaville and open up multiple depots in the city. For himself and his family, Valence dreams of building their own home and sending his kids to good schools.
texts.en:
Valence is a member of the community bank group Les Bonnes Volontes (1) and helps lead a subgroup of eight other microentrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For the last ten years, Valence has run his own business: a drinks depot in Brazzaville. The father of three young children, Valence has big dreams to send his children to the best schools in Brazzaville. In order to have the money to do so, Valence wants to grow his business. 

In 2014, Valence joined Les Bonnes Volontes (1) at HOPE Congo to grow his business. Now on his third loan cycle, Valence would like to take out a loan of 350,000 CFA to purchase additional capital: 15 cases of drinks to sell to restaurants around Brazzaville. 

The main challenge for Valence’s depot is when problems occur in the bottling factory, causing a rupture in his stock. In order to prevent this, Valence often keeps back a few extra drink flavors to better serve his clientele. 

In the future, Valence hopes to become exclusive with one of the drink factories near Brazzaville and open up multiple depots in the city. For himself and his family, Valence dreams of building their own home and sending his kids to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase additional drinks for his depot.

loans.name: Eder Manuel

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Eder desea montar un negocio de venta de minutos, accesorios y recargas a celular en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio su hijo mayor que lo impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque el siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar una vitrina y surtido de accesorios y recargas para celular.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de un padre colombiano!
texts.en: Inspired by his dreams of success and of overcoming his difficulties, Eder wishes to set up a business selling cell phone credit, accessories and chargers from his home, located in the town of Tierra Alta. This idea was motivated by his son who urged him to set up this business so that he could generate a much-needed income in order to sustain the family's needs. Although Eder has always wanted to be independent, he didn't previously have any desire to take a risk by setting up a business; however, he now feels determined and capable of doing so. He is applying for a loan to buy a display cabinet and a range of cell phone accessories and chargers. He plans to use these items to start his business and to, hopefully, fulfil his dreams of independence. Eder states that, 'with this loan, you would be helping to advance the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian father!'.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and a range of cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Ricaurte

texts.es:
Ricaurte es un hombre de campo y padre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para el y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Ricaurte is a country man and a father of 2 children, for whom he has had to go through a lot of adversity in his life. However, he has always had the strength to carry on and to continue to progress with his family.

For some time he has wanted to start a business raising and selling chickens. This is why he is applying for financial support to buy some chickens and materials to build a chicken coop. 

With this new business he will be able to generate enough income for his family who mean everything to him. He will be able to improve the quality of life of both his wife and children. 

He will work every day to get his business off the ground and to make it a sustainable and profitable activity. 

Support a hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens and materials to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Yesu Ni Jibu Group
