texts.fr: Madame BIRAGI est âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants tous étudiants est présidente du groupe YSEU NI JIBU. Elle s’occupe de la vente des produits alimentaires divers. Elle vient solliciter un pret qui lui servira d’acheter 3 sacs de haricots de 100kg, 20 sacs de maïs, 20 sacs de manioc. Son reve est de construire sa maison et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle tient à remercier HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle ne cesse d’apporter aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: 43-year-old Biragi is the president of the Yseu Ni Jibu Group. She is a married mother to eight children who are all currently receiving an education. She earns a living through selling various foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase three 100-kg sacks of beans, 20 sacks of maize and 20 sacks of manioc. Her dream is to build her own house and to be able to pay for her children's school fees. She would like to thank Hekima for their untiring support of low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase three 100-kg sacks of beans, 20 sacks of maize and 20 sacks of manioc

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Joyce operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for eight years. She makes additional income by selling fried cassava and sweet potatoes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She hopes to buy a refrigerator to start selling cold drinks. 

Joyce has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour and beans.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour and beans

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de venta de calzado.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de calzado al por mayor para hombre y dama. De este modo podrá iniciar con un buen inventario.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una veterana llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en: Catalina is a creative and entrepreneurial lady who, for a long time, has wanted to have her own shoe retail business so that she could work independently. At the moment her dream may come true due to her great capacity for hard work, the support that she receives from Interactuar and those people who want to see her business succeed. She spends her income on her dependent children and she hopes to teach them about the business so that, one day, they will eventually inherit it from her. She is applying for a loan to buy a range of men's and ladies' shoes at wholesale prices so that she can start off her business with a good stock level. By funding this loan, you would be supporting a veteran working lady who is full of life and dedicated to her family.

loans.use: to buy a range of men's and ladies' shoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Bertilda

texts.es:
Bertilda, una señora de 69 años, vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Esta mujer de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de restaurante en su casa.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Bertilda podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara la educación de algunos de sus hijos

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, algunas adecuaciones locativas y en la compra de surtido e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Colabora a una madre emprendedora, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en: Bertilda is a 69 year old lady who lives in Tierra Alta, a small city with few opportunities for success and where starting a business is a difficult undertaking. This lady has an entrepreneurial mind and a huge desire for success; consequently, she intends to start a restaurant business in her own home. Bertilda will be able to use this loan to fulfil her dreams of being an independent woman and generating her own income, which she will use to educate some of her children. She plans to invest the money in buying chairs and tables as well as making some adjustments to the space in her home. She will also use the loan to buy a range of ingredients used when preparing her meals. She states that by funding this loan, you could be assisting an entrepreneurial mother with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables as well as making some adjustments to the space in her home and to buy a range of ingredients used when preparing her meals.

loans.name: Augusto Javier

texts.es:
Augusto, de 21 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

El desea desempeñarse como criador y vendedor de aves de corral, en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar huevos y pollos de engorde para iniciar efectivamente con su producción.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Augusto is 21 years old and has a very clear idea of what he wants in life. He is determined to finish his studies in order to progress and have a good life. 

He wants to raise and sell poultry in the in municipality of Tierra Alta. He wants to start doing this job in order to earn enough to get by financially, to pay for his studies and to help out with household expenses. He is an entrepreneurial young man, and very disciplined.

The loan that he is asking for is to buy eggs and broiler chickens to start effectively with production. 

He hopes to be able to progress as a business owner and have a stable income. He is grateful for all the people that can contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to buy eggs and broiler chickens.

loans.name: Magali Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magali, una madre de 36 años de edad con 8 hijos a su cuidado, es madre cabeza de hogar y ha podido sostener a su numerosa familia gracias a que trabaja como productora agropecuaria en la finca de sus padres. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría con pollos y gallinas los cuales criara y alimentara en los corrales de sus padres, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír. 

Apoyen a esta empresaria que quiere demostrar que el papel de madre y padre no le queda pequeño solo necesita tu voto de confianza
texts.en:
Magali is 36 years old and a mother to eight children Magali is the head of her household and has been able to support her large family thanks to her work at her parents' farm.

Magali is applying for a loan in order to start her own business, a small business raising hens and chickens, which she will keep at corrals on her parents' farm. Magali is taking initiative and starting this business for her children: she wants to enjoy a better life with them, one in which they can study and always have a reason to smile.

Support this businesswoman: she wants to prove that the role of mothers and fathers is no small one. All she needs is your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to buy hens and chickens.

loans.name: Larha'ansima Group

texts.fr: Madame NSIMIRE est présidente du groupe LARHANSIMA.  A  l’âge de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle s’occupe de la vente des chemises sur la rue depuis l’année 2000. Le prêt demandé lui servira d’acheter 2 douzaines de chemises. Son vœu est d’acheter une parcelle et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Nsimire is the president of the Larha'ansima Group. She is a 57-year-old married mother to five children, who are all on the way to receiving an education. She has earned a living through selling shirts as a street vendor since 2000. This loan will be used to purchase two dozen shirts. It is her wish to purchase a plot of land and pay for her children's school fees. She would like to thank Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two dozen shirts

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 53 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Rosie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, vinegar, noodles, sanitary pads, toothpaste, biscuits, coffee, etc. 

Rosie requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kimsorn's Group

texts.en:
Kimsorn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Kimsorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling cake to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 43-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers from the Matete district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Margaret has noticed that she has learnt a lot from the farming training.

Margaret describes her harvest as good last year but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Margaret’s group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy vegetables. 

Ana opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $50. Ana is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Oscar Luis

texts.es:
Oscar, a sus 49 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos de 14, 15 y 20 años. 
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, pues no cuenta con el capital para iniciar un negocio y está desempleado; esto lo llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, una tienda de víveres y abarrotes, piensa laborar toda la semana y los fines de semana durante todo el día. 

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra insumos al por mayor como granos, galletas, bebidas, entre otros, de esta manera dará inicio a su idea de negocio, aprovechando la buena ubicación del sector donde pondrá su negocio, pues es una zona muy transitada y existe la posibilidad de atraer muchos clientes potenciales. 

De esta forma, Oscar espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un negocio en un local bien acreditado, que le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar a mediano plazo, sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 49 years old and a father to three children, ages 20, 15, and 14 years old.

Owing to the lack of employment opportunities, Oscar has been experiencing a very difficult financial situation; he is unemployed and does not have the capital to start a business. This brought Oscar to search for options to get ahead. He wants to start his own business, a grocery and supplies shop. He plans to work all day every day (including weekends).

For this reason, Oscar is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies, such as grains, biscuits, drinks and more, in bulk. With these items he can start his business, taking advantage of the good location where he will open his business. The area is much frequented and there are many potential customers.

By starting this business, Oscar hopes to earn the necessary income in order to get ahead with his family and offer his children a better education. The loan will move Oscar closer to his dream of starting a business that earns him an income to improve his and his children's quality of life in the medium-term future.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as grains, biscuits, drinks and more, in bulk.

loans.name: Sokneang's Group

texts.en:
Sokneang’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. 

Sokneang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phang's Group

texts.en:
Phang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Phang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Katembe Tukolerehamu Group

texts.en:
Evaristo is a thirty-one-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail outlet as his main business and does farming for extra income. He ventured into business three years back and it has enabled him to cater for his family needs using the proceeds. 

Like other small-scale retailers, Evaristo is challenged by competition from people with similar business and by price fluctuations.  He needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Juan desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus padres.

Se caracteriza por ser un joven alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With a lot of drive and perseverance, Juan wishes to begin a business breeding and raising pigs in his home, located in the Tierra Alta municipality.

This idea arises from the necessity to generate a good income to contribute to the maintenance of the home in which he lives with his parents.

He is characterized by being a young man who is happy and very cooperative, qualities that allowed him to gain the affection and respect of the people that live on the lane.

With this loan, he will be able to begin this business.

The money will be invested in the purchase of small pigs and materials to construct a garage.

loans.use: to purchase small pigs and materials to construct a garage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a shop window and replacement parts for electrical appliances.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is a  fisherman from Dulag, Leyte. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He is a 40-year-old man with an eight-year-old son. It has been more than 20 years now that he has been fishing.


He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net. These tools will ease his on-going fishing activity. They will cause him to have more catch. Slowly, he will earn more, and start to manage his finances. He will be able to provide his family with a nutritious diet.

 In the future, Angelo hopes that he will be successful in handling his source of income to become more productive and to have a better status of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her business: rice, maize and baking flour, beans, vegetables and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Naidut Leonor

texts.es:
Naidut es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.
Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de cosméticos como rubor y cremas para obtener algunos ingresos.
Es una mujer muy aplicada pues quiere estudiar y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, estantería y compra de inventario en productos cosméticos.
Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su familia todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una mujer emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Naidut is a woman with the energy and disposition to face the world and get ahead. She wants to start a business selling cosmetics, such as blush and creams, to obtain some income. She is a very dedicated woman and she want to get ahead and graduate from college.
  
She is asking for this loan to buy a display case, shelving, and an inventory of cosmetic products. With this loan, she can make her dream come true of becoming independent and giving her family everything they need, in addition to paying for her education and progressing thanks to the support from Kiva and Corporación Interactuar.

Support this project of an enterprising Colombian woman!

loans.use: to buy a display case, shelving and an inventory of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Theudith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Theudith, una joven de 27 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivada y emocionada ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la Corporación Interactuar puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de productos de panificación, un sueño que le ha sido errado pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia no le desembolsaban el préstamo. 

Con el crédito solicitado comprara surtido de pasteles, hojaldres y panes al por mayor, además de uniformes para poder iniciar este negocio con pie derecho y con toda la fe del mundo.
Este crédito será de suma importancia para Theudith pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente y una oportunidad de progresar como empresaria.
texts.en:
Theudith is a 27 year old woman who is very motivated and excited with this opportunity she is getting, and it is thanks to Corporación Interactuar that she can ask for a loan to start her own business selling baked goods. This is a dream that she had to put off because in her first credit experience the loan wasn't disbursed.  

With this loan she will buy a selection of cakes, puff pastries and bread wholesale, in addition to uniforms to start the business with the right foot forward and with all the faith in the world. 

This loan will be of utmost importance for Theudith, because it represents the principle of being independent in life and an opportunity to progress as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cakes, puff pastries and bread wholesale, in addition to uniforms to start the business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has two children. She is running a secondhand business that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy clothes such as shirts, trousers, shorts and t-shirts. She opened her secondhand business a year ago with her own working capital of $280.

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some construction materials such as cement and sand to renovate the house inside and outside.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Margaret, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Margaret joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Margaret plans to send her children to school.

Between the nine farmers in Margaret's Group, a total of five acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: María Bersabe

texts.es:
María, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, vive solo con sus dos hijas, de las cuales una estudia y la mayor le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar, además vive con ella su mamá, la cual también depende de ella.

María, se dedica a la agricultura, la cual tiene 20 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia y lo aprendió de sus padres.- Actualmente, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en un terreno que se encuentra a cinco minutos de su casa.

María, utilizará el crédito para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará a cortar la cosecha y además comprará unos ternero para pastar animales, por lo que espera tener ganancias y poder cancelar el crédito.

Los suenos de  María, son poder construir su vivienda propia, ya que donde vive es de una hermana y ayudar a su hija para que estudie.
texts.en:
María, 52 years old, studied until the sixth grade. She is a single mother. She lives alone with her two daughters, of whom one studies and the older helps her with the housework. Furthermore, she lives with her mother, who also depends on her.

María makes a living from agriculture. She has made a living from this activity for 20 years, because of which she has a lot of experience. She learned it from her parents. Currently, she cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn in land that can be found five minutes from her home.

María will use the loan to pay costs of labor that will help her to reap the harvest, and she will also purchase some land to graze animals, because of which she hopes to make better profits and be able to pay off the loan.

María’s dreams are to be able to construct her own home, since where she lives belongs to her sister, and to help her daughter to study.

loans.use: to pay labor costs that will help her to reap the harvest and also to purchase some land.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. Agnes lives in her own house. She has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication. 

Agnes runs a pub. She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days a week. Agnes sells her products by means of retail. Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin. The main business challenges for Agnes include defaulters and the increasing price of beer. 

Her goals are to see her business grow large, to own a fully stocked pub and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 57 years old, a father of three, and he is a farmer. His wife, Virginia manages a retail store and sells grocery items. They are both engaged in a business to sustain the family's needs for meals and bills at home. He plants and harvests rice and corn with the help of laborers he pays, too. 

Willy wants to improve his crop production in his rice field; that is why he is now asking for additional capital of P50,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. This will help improve his income and will also pay his laborers. Additional revenue will be kept for education purposes and also to invest in the retail store of his wife. (His photo was taken at the rice field with the supervisor accompanying him.)

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 55 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns income from an electronic mobile load retailing business.

Ma. Luz aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erias

texts.en: Erias a married and hardworking man. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he sells produce and does farming to generate income for his family. He used the previous loan to buy maize for resale and managed to increase his profits. He maintains his dream of growing his business into new areas, despite the challenge of competition leading to low returns. Erias is requesting for a loan to buy beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Violeta is 52 years old. Three of her children are still in school.

Violeta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Violeta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Liliana Milena

texts.es:
Liliana es madre de 1 hijo de 11 años y vive en unión libre. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de El Carmen De Viboral en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de Caña de azucar.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Liliana sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.

¡Impacte la vida de Liliana y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Liliana is the mother of an 11 year old son and she is in a common law marriage. Apart from her family, she has worked in agriculture for ten years. She learned about the business empirically, that is, through practice and observing other people.  
 
She and her family live in the rural are of El Carmen De Viboral where there is no easy access to financial services such as the ones offered by  Corporación Interactuar. 

She is going to use her loan to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to do maintenance and support for her sugar cane crops. Thanks to this loan, her family's finances and quality of life will improve because she will be able to increase her income. 

Liliana dreams of finishing the probate of the papers for her land so she can have complete control over it.

Impact Liliana and her family's life with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as seeds, pest control products and fertilizer.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and has 12 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Margaret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Ermera. She is married and has four children. She is a businesswoman, so she is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more goods to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, detergent, biscuits, noodles, sugar, condiments, candies, candles, eggs, and other things to sell, including soft and hard drinks.

Domingas opened her business in 2012 with her working capital of $1,000. She is very happy to do her business because with her business, she was able to meet all the needs in the household. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to get a good management for her business. She also has animals like cows, dogs, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy slippers, detergent, biscuits,  noodles, sugar, condiments, candies, candles, eggs, and other things to sell, including soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more solar equipment to sell.

loans.name: Seangim's Group

texts.en:
Seangim’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Seangim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help this man and woman to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Saim's Group

texts.en:
Saim’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Saim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
The members of La’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. La makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat lives in Tursunzoda town with her large family consisting of 10 persons. She is 55 years old. She is an active, hardworking and responsible woman.

Inobat has been involved in agriculture for seven years. She sows vegetables in her greenhouse and she likes this activity, because she receives income from it and also provides her family with fresh vegetables at all seasons.

Currently Inobat needs a loan to buy tomato and cucumber seeds, and for this reason she requested a loan to start sowing. This loan will help her achieve her goals and later, to get a new harvest. Inobat hopes for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cucumber  and tomato seeds for planting in the greenhouse

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
Asma was born 1979, is married and has three school-age children. She has had two micro-businesses: a charcoal store and a cosmetics selling business. She has been in these business since 2001, working from 8:30am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.

Using Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth loan request, to be apportioned among Serena's Group, with five members in the group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Asma used her previous loans to restock all of her businesses. She managed to pay back her previous loans successfully. She used the profits to cover school fees and household expenses. 

In the coming years, Eliza would like to improve her standard of living. She will use this new loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Romeo Jr

texts.en:
Romeo Jr. operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various goods ranging from dried fish, powdered milk, vinegar, coffee, fruit flavored juices and bread to biscuits and candies. He is a 36-year-old married man with four children from Mayorga, Leyte. His oldest child is 14, and the youngest is 2. In addition to that, he also engages in a meat-vending business.

He has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages and seasonings. This stock will improve his daily earnings,  causing him to attract more customers and slowly manage his finances.

Romeo Jr. would like to expand both of his businesses to be able to continue to finance the education of his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages and seasonings

loans.name: Elick

texts.en:
Elick is a 48-year-old married man with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He runs a private school, where he earns additional income alongside selling cow milk to the local community. 

Elick has been in the business of cattle trading for more than ten years and this has helped him to look after his family. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital to meet his customers’ demands. He has a personal goal of educating his children and extending his cattle trading business to new areas so as to earn more profits. Elick will use the loan to buy cows for selling.

loans.use: buying cows for selling.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy spirits, jerrycans of local brew, crates of soda, and beer. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a television set to entertain her customers. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy spirits, jerrycans of local brew, crates of soda, and beer

loans.name: Augusto De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Augusto es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Señor Augusto is an experienced carpenter, having learned woodworking skills many years ago when he worked in a series of jobs in various carpentry shops. Eventually, he set up his own shop, and has overcome challenges and provided for his family, which lives in the rural town of El Carmen De Viboral. 

Señor Augusto's greatest source of pride is the excellent reputation and standing he's earned thanks to his high-quality work. He has made many pieces furniture with his own two hands, including nearly everything in the simple home that he also built himself.  

Señor Augusto is applying for a loan for the purchase of wood with which he can make more furniture and make his business more profitable. 

His most important goals are for his children; he wants to ensure that they have an excellent education and become successful adults.

loans.use: to purchase wood that will allow him to make more furniture.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
The members of Saran’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Margaret described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very resourceful person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Margaret is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Margaret has been a farmer for more than 30 years and in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming supplies, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Margaret is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 5.75 acres will be planted by Margaret's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as to purchase a solar light.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 65 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Margaret is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Margaret started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Margaret’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light; so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Channa makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Guoqing

texts.en:
Guoqing is a 52-year-old woman. She is married with two children who are working outside of the home. Guoqing and her husband have no other jobs except for feeding and selling pigs. Their business began more than 30 years ago. 

It was a rough time when Guoqing's second child was born. At that time, following policy, they should have had only one child. It cost Guoqing 7,000 CNY, which she loaned from her relatives, to have her younger child. The couple worked very hard and paid off the debt in just two years. 

Guoqing used the income earned by selling pigs to support her children to adult age. She has a high reputation from her clients. 

She requested 20,000 CNY from MicroCred to buy some pigs. The income from the business will help her to improve the business and to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy some pigs.

loans.name: Qinfen

texts.en:
Qinfen is a 34-year-old woman. She is married with two children who both are in primary school. Also, she has to support her mother-in-law.

Qinfen comes from Guizhou Province, which takes about eight hours by car. Qinfen is a hardworking and strong woman. She and her husband have had more than 100 pigs since two years ago. They have to do all the work, such as to cook the food, clean the pigpen, and so on. The income from the pigs helps her support the family. 

Qinfen requested 20,000 CNY from MicroCred to buy some feed. She believes that she can pay off the loan quickly and her family will have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling green bananas on a retail basis at the market for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to increase her capital base so as to serve her customers better.

She lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 45 years old and a married woman with a three-year-old son. She is from Dulag, Leyte, and works preparing and selling pop-rice to locals in her community. This is usually made by heating rice kernels under high pressure in the presence of steam. The kernels are then set aside. Oil is heated and mixed with poured sugar or any desired taste and added to the kernels. 

Melchora is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil to use in making pop rice. Her loan will result in a higher income. Slowly, Melchora will be able to balance her finances and start to repay her obligations. She will also be able to provide her child with a proper diet. In the future, Melchora dreams of expanding her source of income to become successful and productive to improve her living status.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is aged in her fifties. She is a widow and has five children; four are grown and one is still in school. She has been supporting her family by running a business selling charcoal, a business she has been in for three years. Eliza started this business with the support of a Kiva loan, her first credit. She is now doing great and is able to sell more stock. She starts doing business from  6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each day. 

This is her seventh credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits to buy big stock of charcoal; this helped to manage demand from her customers, who are many. She used the extra income to cover her family expenses, covered school fees and bought a mattress. 

She is so thankful for Kiva's support to her business and family. She dreams to build a house for her family. Eliza has paid back successfully her previous credits. With this new request, she will buy sacks of charcoal to resell.  She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Al hablar de Carlos no se puede evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Carlos no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar una tienda para complementar sus actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estar, quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente y es por esta razón que el señor Carlos solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que distribuye y que incluso vende lo que cultiva en su tierra.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar el local donde actualmente opera
texts.en:
When people speak of Carlos, they can't help but observe that he's natural born farmer, with the strong, distinctive values of the Colombian countryside. Carlos displays the humility and work ethic that are the hallmarks of Colombian farmers. 

Carlos wasn't earning enough money from farming, and decided to open a store that would generate additional income. Carlos found that the farm left him with significant down time, and like any farmer, he couldn't remain idle; Carlos has to be working constantly. He therefore is applying for a loan for the purchase of inventory for his store, such as grains, grocery items, snacks, and candy. These items will complement the principal items that Carlos sells, which include the produce he grows on his land. 

Carlos hopes that God will allow him to remain in good health so that he can keep working tirelessly and earn the income he needs to purchase the site where he now works.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his store, such as grains, grocery items, snacks, and candy.

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en:
Cyclin is 43 years old and married, and she lives in Tacdog, Siquijor, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement. 

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. 

She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions. At the same time, she is also a butcher who sells lean meat to the community.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in Irbid. A single guy, 22 years old, he is studying finance because he likes to work in this field and he hopes to complete advanced studies. He is one of six family members so he has a big family, and that's why his father is facing financial difficulties. 

Mohammad can not pay university fees on time, so that adversely affected him. Therefore he applied for an education loan to cover his university fees. Mohammad needs your support to complete his studies.

loans.use: to cover his university fees. Mohammad needs your support to complete his studies.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's Group has been formed by ten farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Margaret, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, married and has one child. Margaret has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Margaret isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money since then. 

This year, Margaret will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Margaret's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Kigunda Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Rosemary a married woman of 40 years of age. She sells produce, primarily maize and ground nuts, alongside doing farming and rearing cattle in Kagadi, Uganda, to pay school fees for her children. Rosemary desires to grow her business and educate her children with the profits from her business, despite the challenge of a lot of competition that affects her returns. 

Rosemary is requesting a loan to buy maize for resale. She is a member of Kigunda Abeteraine, a group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities. The extra person in the photo is the baby of a group member who could not be left behind because the baby is too young.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better harvest this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Margaret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Margaret, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. Margaret has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Margaret isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming training courses ever since. This year, Margaret will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Margaret's Group will purchase a total of 16 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many kinds of sewing material, such as thread, zippers, fabrics, buttons, and other items, in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Rin’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Rin makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
An 800 USD loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2009, with her own working capital of 150 USD. 

She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store, such as fish, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, water, biscuits, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and cards. 

Domingas is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in the business. She lives in a town with her family, and she has pigs and chickens and also a very simple home.

loans.use: to buy fish, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, water, biscuits, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and cards.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Margaret is representing her group of 11 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Margaret has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Margaret is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Margaret's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sreykeo's Group

texts.en:
Sreykeo’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreykeo makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. She has one son in her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his mid-20s, has one child who is still young. He has been supporting his family by running a gengeduka (a small grocery store), selling fruits, vegetables and other items, such as matchboxes, cooking oil, salt, rice, maize and baking flour, sweets, juices, etc. He has been in this business for five years now, working from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily. Salum is able to realize a good profit each month. 

Using Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his tenth credit request,  to be apportioned among the five members of Uwezesho Group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Salum used the previous loans, which he paid back successfully, to replenish his business with the most-demanded items. He is now doing great and has seen the step ahead to his business. 

Salum dreams to open a big shop, selling more products. He managed to earn extra income, which he used to cover his life expenses. With his new loan, he will buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. 

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past year. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy land and start farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last year. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fess and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dorika

texts.en:
Dorika lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. Together, they live in Dorika's home and have access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

For five years, Dorika has been selling clothes door-to-door, working six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. In the future, Dorika aspires to have a permanent stall for selling used clothes. Her loan request of UGX 100,000 from MCDT – SACCO would help her to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita  goes fishing. She sells fish to the nearby neighborhoods in her town. She is a 48-year-old married woman with six  children from Dulag, Leyte. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 9. Aside from fishing, she also raises and sells ducks.

Marianita is asking for a loan  to buy fishing materials like fishing net. These will improve her on-going catch.  She will have more fish to sell. With these, she will have more earnings. She can then continue to manage her finances and start to pay her dues.

In the future, Marianita hopes that she can properly handle both her businesses to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: Analia

texts.en:
Analia is 41 years old and has three children.  Analia is married and all of her children are in school.

Analia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Analia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Norma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Norma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 70 years old and is a widow-woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has an upholstery business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her upholstery business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Kayembe Thuyihimbe Group

texts.en:
Rusia is a thirty-eight-year-old female, married with eight children, and she is a member of Kayembe Thuyihimbe group, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Rusia sells fresh foods such as cabbages, onions, tomatoes, oranges, and many other foods in order to get income and look after her family. 

She has a dream of educating her children and building a residential house. However, she is faced with the challenge of some goods perishing and poor seasons. 

Rusia wants money to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and other foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and other foods for selling.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 29 and a mother of two. For the past eight years, she has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya. Her primary sources of income are selling maize, vegetables, bananas, and the profits from a small-time personal business. 

Rosaline is requesting a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that, with her current farm implements, she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. Women in her area are currently doing work on the farm that was previously done by men. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find higher wages as laborers in urban areas. Therefore, the tools the women use are of great importance for improving farm productivity and yields and for reducing time and physical effort. There are also health implications of using traditional tools. Roseline will use the increased income from her loan to help meet her business-related expenses. When asked how her loan will benefit her children, Roseline replied, “I will be able to educate my children.”

loans.use: to purchase modern farming implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is forty-one years old. He is a male, married, has four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Paul has been operating a general merchandise store since 2012. He is also a teacher by profession where he earns a salary. 

Paul has a dream of educating his children and growing his business into a wholesale business. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

Paul wants money to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 45 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Florence likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming training sessions. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize
